1625.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist with rerouting the Mississippi Export Railroad Company main line in Jackson County.
1625.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Rerouting The Mississippi Export Railroad Company Main Rail Line In Jackson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1626.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements at Trent Lott International Airport in Jackson County.
1626.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To Trent Lott International Airport In Jackson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1627.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for purposes related to improvements at Helena Industrial Site in Jackson County.
1627.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Developing Plans And Routes And Obtaining Necessary Permits Relating To The Design, Construction And Implementation Of Water, Wastewater, Power And Other Infrastructure Related Facilities And Improvements At And In Close Proximity To The Helena Industrial Site In Jackson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1628.title: Income tax; allow deduction for retrofit of residence in coastal counties to mitigate damage from certain weather events.
1628.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Individual Taxpayers Whose Legal Residence Is In Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, George, Stone Or Pearl River Counties For Certain Costs Of Retrofitting Their Residence With Certain Fortification Measures That Are Designed To Increase The Resistance Of The Residence To Hurricane, Tornado, Or Catastrophic Windstorm Event Damage; To Provide The Amount Of The Deduction; And For Related Purposes.

1629.title: Tobacco equity tax; does not apply to subsequent participating manufacturers until certain credit amendment to master settlement agreement.
1629.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-70-3 And 27-70-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Tobacco Equity Tax On Cigarettes, Formerly Known As The Nonsettling-manufacturer Cigarette Fee, Does Not Apply To Cigarettes Or Tobacco Sold By An Entity That Is A Subsequent Participating Manufacturer, For Purposes Of Participating In The Original Tobacco Settlement Agreement, Until A Certain Described Credit Amendment Has Been Made A Part Of The Master Settlement Agreement; To Set Forth Additional Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

1630.title: Bonds; authorize for various economic development programs and for other purposes.
1630.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Job Protection Act Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $331,500,000.00 To $346,500,000.00, The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $40,100,000.00 To $55,100,000.00, The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $40,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Amend Section 57-40-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "project" As Used In The Energy Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program; To Amend Section 57-40-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Fund May Be Used To Assist Energy Providing Utility Companies And Cooperatives; To Amend Sections 57-40-5 And 57-40-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning, State Agencies And Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of $9,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Be Distributed Equally Among The Community And Junior College Districts; To Authorize The Issuance Of $5,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of $2,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Assisting Counties And Municipalities In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair Of Jails And Related Facilities For Damage Caused As A Result Of Any Disaster For Which The Governor Issued A Disaster Declaration; To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1631.title: City of Itta Bena; authorize contributions to the Mississippi Valley State University Mass Transit.
1631.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Itta Bena, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Mississippi Valley State University Mass Transit For The Purpose Of Providing Transportation To Its Elderly And Disabled Citizens; And For Related Purposes.

1632.title: Bolivar County; authorize contribution to the Bolivar County Community Action Agency, Inc.
1632.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Bolivar County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Bolivar County Community Action Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1633.title: City of Florence; extend repealer on city's bars and restaurants.
1633.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 939, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 1046, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, To Extend The Repeal Date From December 31, 2014, To December 31, 2016, On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Florence To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of The Sales Of Bars And Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

1634.title: Sales tax; reduce rate imposed on retail sales of boats, motorcycles and towable campers.
1634.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Rate Of Sales Tax Imposed On Retail Sales Of Boats, Motorcycles And Towable Campers; And For Related Purposes.

1635.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1635.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Mississippi Food Network; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; We Care Community Services, Inc.; Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

1636.title: Local System Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund; authorize issuance of bonds to provide funds for.
1636.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1637.title: Income and franchise tax; allow refundable credit for costs of purchasing and installing a solar electric energy system.
1637.description: An Act To Authorize An Income And/or Franchise Tax Credit Equal To A Certain Amount Of The Cost Of Purchasing And Installing Solar Electric Energy Systems; To Provide That The Credit Shall Apply To All Solar Electric Energy Systems Installed On Or After July 1, 2010; To Provide The Manner In Which The Credit May Be Claimed; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income And/or Franchise Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1638.title: Appropriation; University of Mississippi Medical Center Medicaid reimbursements; additional for FY 2012.
1638.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of State General Funds To The University Of Mississippi Medical Center For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expense Of Medicaid Reimbursements For Fiscal Year 2012.

1639.title: Natural Gas Vehicles for Mississippi Act of 2012; create.
1639.description: An Act To Create The "natural Gas Vehicles For Mississippi Act Of 2012"; To Create New Section 27-7-22.37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Any Taxpayer Purchasing, Constructing Or Installing A Natural Gas Conversion Kit On A Motor Vehicle, A Motor Vehicle With A Natural Gas Motor Fuel System As Original Equipment, A Refueling System Installed At A Private Home Or Residence Or At A Business For Nonpublic Refueling With Natural Gas Of Personal Or Business Natural Gas Motor Vehicles, Or A Refueling Station Operated For Refueling Of Natural Gas Motor Vehicles Owned By The Taxpayer, Private Customers Of The Taxpayer Or The General Public; To Amend Section 27-65-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Natural Gas For Use As Taxable Motor Fuel; To Amend Sections 27-59-3, 27-59-7, 27-59-9, 27-59-11, 27-59-12, 27-59-13, 27-59-17, 27-59-23, 27-59-25, 27-59-29, 27-59-31, 27-59-33, 27-59-35, 27-59-41, 27-59-47, 27-59-57 And 27-59-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Delivery Of Natural Gas To Private Refueling Systems And Public Refueling Stations; To Provide For Annual Privilege Tax Permits For Government Vehicles And For Licensing Of Refueling Systems, Refueling Stations And Dealer And Installers Of Compressed Gas Fuel Equipment; To Provide For Monthly Reports By Dealers And Installers Of Compressed Gas Fuel Equipment; To Authorize The Cancellation Of Licenses Of Such Dealers And Installers Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Forfeiture By Dealers And Installers Of Licenses Under Certain Circumstances; To Impose Record Keeping Requirements On Dealers And Installers; To Revise Requirements For The Issuance Of Compressed Gas User's Decals; To Require The Owner Of A Fleet Of Motor Vehicles Using Compressed Gas As A Fuel To File Annual Reports On A Fleet Basis As Opposed To An Individual Motor Vehicle Basis; To Provide For The Inspection Of Private Refueling Stations; To Provide The Manner In Which Refunds Of Overpayment Of Taxes Shall Be Made To Certain Users And Distributors; And For Related Purposes.

1640.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for sales tax paid on purchase of certain electric vehicles.
1640.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For The Amount Of Sales Tax Or Use Tax Paid By A Taxpayer On The Purchase Of A Qualified Plug-in Electric Drive Vehicle Or Qualified Hybrid Electric Vehicle; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit That May Be Claimed; To Provide That Any Amount For Which A Credit Is Claimed Under This Section May Not Be Used As A Deduction By The Taxpayer For State Income Tax Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1641.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for construction of the Wellspring Center for Professional Futures.
1641.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Wellspring Center For Professional Futures In Union County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1642.title: Forrest County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1642.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Forrest County To Contribute Funds To The Association For Retarded Citizens, Big Brothers/big Sisters Of Southeast Mississippi, The Boy Scouts Of America, The Gulf Pine Girl Scout Council, The Hattiesburg Downtown Association, Inc., The Neighborhood Education Enhancement Development Services, The Salvation Army, Pearl River Valley Opportunity, The Pinebelt Association For Community Enhancement, The Hattiesburg Little League Baseball Association, Petal Optimist Club Baseball, First Tee And The Aids Services Coalition; And For Related Purposes.

1643.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of certain home medical equipment and supplies when paid for under insurance policy or plan.
1643.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Certain Home Medical Equipment And Supplies When Payment For The Equipment And Supplies Is Made On Behalf Of Or For The Benefit Of An Insured Under An Insurance Policy, Contract Or Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1644.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements to the Port of Vicksburg.
1644.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Port Of Vicksburg; And For Related Purposes.

1645.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers that employ persons convicted of felony offenses.
1645.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Employ Persons Who Have Been Convicted Of Felony Offenses; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; And For Related Purposes.

1646.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for purchase and installation of solar water heater system.
1646.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Costs Incurred By A Taxpayer For The Purchase And Installation Of A Solar Water Heater System In Property That Is The Primary Residence Of The Taxpayer Or That Is Owned By The Taxpayer And Rented To Others For Dwelling Purposes; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1647.title: Tishomingo County; authorize to make certain contributions to Crow's Neck Environmental Education Center.
1647.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Make An Annual Allocation To The Crow's Neck Environmental Education Center; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Seek Allocations From Certain Counties To Assist In The Operation Of The Center; And For Related Purposes.

1648.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for certain retrofitting or upgrades to homes in Coastal Area of Mississippi.
1648.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Deduction For Certain Retrofitting Or Upgrades To Homes Located In The Coastal Area Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1649.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; revise rate.
1649.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-12, 27-55-19 And 27-55-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Exemptions And Refunds Under The Gasoline Excise Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Undyed Diesel Fuel; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-521, 27-55-523 And 27-55-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Mississippi Special Fuel Tax Law, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Distribution Of Fuel Taxes, For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1650.title: Appropriation; State Board of Education to defray certain expenses of East Webster High School.
1650.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Board Of Education To Defray Certain Expenses Of East Webster High School For The Fiscal Year 2013.

1651.title: City of Grenada; authorize to increase tourist and convention tax to construct a sports park and promotion of tourism.
1651.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 879, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 940, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Grenada, Mississippi, To Increase The Tourist And Convention Tax Levied Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals And Restaurant Sales In The City; To Provide For An Election On The Question Of Whether Or Not Such Tax May Be Increased; To Provide That Revenue Collected From The Additional Tax Increase Shall Be Used For The Construction, Financing And Operation Of A Sports Park Or Any Other Use That May Promote Tourism As Determined By The City; To Require That Such Revenue Be Placed In An Interest Bearing Tourism Escrow Fund; To Provide That If Such Tax Increase Is Rejected By Voters Then The Current Tax Shall Remain In Full Force And Effect; And For Related Purposes.

1652.title: Hinds county; grant certain authority to Hinds County Human Resource Agency.
1652.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County, Mississippi, To Authorize The Board Of Directors Of The Hinds County Human Resource Agency To Exercise Certain Powers; And For Related Purposes.

1653.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on sale of power and fuel to a producer of oil and gas for use in oil recovery or sequestration of carbon dioxide.
1653.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Sale Of Electricity, Current, Power, Steam, Coal, Natural Gas, Liquefied Petroleum Gas Or Other Fuel To A Producer Of Oil And Gas For Use Directly In Enhanced Oil Recovery Using Carbon Dioxide Or The Permanent Sequestration Of Carbon Dioxide In A Geological Formation Shall Be Taxed At The Rate Of 1-1/2%; And For Related Purposes.

1654.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements to the Mississippi Craft Center.
1654.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of And Upgrades And Improvements To The Mississippi Craft Center In Ridgeland, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1655.title: Compressed natural gas; revise manner of taxing that used in motor vehicles.
1655.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-59-3, 27-59-7, 27-59-11 And 27-59-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms For Purposes Of The State Liquefied Compressed Gas Tax Laws; To Provide For A Privilege Tax On Natural Gas Sold Or Delivered By A Utility To The Owner Of A Private Refueling System Or To A Public Refueling Station For Compression Into Compressed Natural Gas For Use As Fuel In Motor Vehicles; To Provide That A Utility That Sells Or Delivers Natural Gas To The Owner Of A Private Refueling System Or To A Public Refueling Station For Such Purposes Shall Install Or Cause To Be Installed A Separate Meter For The Natural Gas To Be Used By The Private Refueling System Or Public Refueling Station For Such Purposes; To Provide That A Person Desiring To Operate A Private Refueling System Or A Public Refueling Station Must First Obtain A Permit From The Department Of Revenue; To Bring Forward Sections 27-59-9, 27-59-13, 27-59-17, 27-59-23, 27-59-25, 27-59-29, 27-59-31, 27-59-33, 27-59-35, 27-59-41 And 27-59-47, Which Are Sections Of The Liquefied Compressed Gas Tax Laws, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1656.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for portion of cost of new alternative fuel vehicle or alternative fuel conversion equipment.
1656.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Purchasing A New Alternative Fuel Vehicle; To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Equipment Installed On A Gasoline Or Diesel Propelled Vehicle To Convert The Vehicle To Operate On An Alternative Fuel; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Prescribe The Maximum Amount Of The One-time Credit Which May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; And For Related Purposes.

1657.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for cost of new alternative fueling infrastructure.
1657.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Installing New Alternative Fueling Infrastructure For Certain Alternative Fuels; To Provide An Income Tax Credit For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Installing A Residential Compressed Natural Gas Fueling System; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Prescribe The Maximum Amount Of The One-time Credit, Based On The Type Of Qualified Clean-burning Motor Vehicle Fuel Property, Which May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; And For Related Purposes.

1658.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for manufacturers of all-electric motor vehicles.
1658.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For Manufacturers Of Electric Motor Vehicles, Including Low- And Medium-speed Electric Vehicles, In The State Of Mississippi; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Prescribe The Per-vehicle Maximum Amount Of The Credit, Based On The Type Of Electric Vehicle, Which May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; And For Related Purposes.

1659.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for certain biodiesel production facilities.
1659.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For Certain Biodiesel Production Facilities In The State Of Mississippi; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; And For Related Purposes.

1660.title: Special fuels tax; assess flat fee for motor vehicles using certain alternative fuels in lieu of.
1660.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-55-522, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish A Flat Fee, To Be Assessed In Lieu Of The Excise Tax On Special Fuels, On Motor Vehicles Using Certain Alternative Fuels; To Prescribe The Amount Of The Flat Fee Based On The Type Of Fuel Used By The Vehicle And The Vehicle's Weight; To Require The Display Of A Decal On Alternative Fuel Vehicles Assessed A Flat Fee; To Direct The Allocation Of Funds Collected From The Flat Fee; To Bring Forward Section 27-55-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Defines Certain Terms Used In The Special Fuel Tax Laws, And Sections 27-55-519 And 27-55-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Levy Of An Excise Tax On Special Fuels, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1661.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for improvements at state parks.
1661.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For Repairs, Renovations And Capital Improvements At State Parks; And For Related Purposes.

1662.title: Income tax; authorize a tax credit for residential builders constructing new single-family, owner-occupied homes in certain areas in the state.
1662.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit For Residential Builders That Construct New Homes For Single-family, Owner-occupied Residential Use In Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, Pearl River, Stone And George Counties; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That The Credit Shall Be For The Sales Tax Paid By The Taxpayer On The Purchase Of Component Materials Used By The Taxpayer In The Construction Of Such Homes; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Provide That Any Unused Portion Of The Credit May Be Carried Forward For The Succeeding Five Tax Years; To Provide That Any Payment That Is Applied Toward The Credit Authorized In This Act May Not Be Used As A Deduction By The Taxpayer For State Income Tax Purposes;

1663.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Jackson in making improvements to the Woodrow Wilson Avenue Bridge.
1663.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Rehabilitation Or Replacement And Reconstruction Of The Woodrow Wilson Avenue Bridge In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1664.title: Sales tax; manufacturers eligible for the manufacturing investment tax credit may use a sales tax exemption in lieu of the credit.
1664.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales And Leases Of Items Included In Certain Eligible Investments Made To Certain Manufacturing Enterprises; To Provide That A Manufacturing Enterprise That Elects To Utilize The Sales Tax Exemption Authorized By This Act Shall Not Be Eligible To Utilize The Manufacturing Investment Tax Credit Authorized By Section 27-7-22.30 For An Eligible Investment That Includes Items To Which The Sales Tax Exemption Is Applied; To Amend Section 27-7-22.30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce To $250,000.00 The Amount Of Investment In Buildings And/or Equipment That Is Necessary For A Manufacturing Enterprise To Be Eligible For The Manufacturing Investment Tax Credit; To Provide That A Manufacturing Enterprise May Elect To Utilize The Sales Tax Exemption Authorized By This Act In Lieu Of The Manufacturing Investment Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1665.title: City of Horn Lake; extend repeal date on hotel and motel tourism tax.
1665.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1015, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 922, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Authority Of The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Horn Lake, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals, Which Shall Be Used To Promote The City's Tourism And Economic Development; To Provide For An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of The Levying Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1666.title: Humphreys County; authorize contribution to the Belzoni-Humphreys Development Foundation.
1666.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Humphreys County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Belzoni-humphreys Development Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

1667.title: Suffrage; restore to Harvey L. Jackson of Warren County.
1667.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Harvey L. Jackson Of Warren County, Mississippi.

1668.title: Forrest County General Hospital; expand jurisdiction of law enforcement officers employed by.
1668.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 916, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Expand The Enforcement Authority Of Persons Employed As Law Enforcement Officers By The Board Of Trustees Of Forrest County General Hospital To All Violations Of Law That Occur On Or Within 500 Feet Of Any Property Leased Or Managed By Forrest County General Hospital; And For Related Purposes.

1669.title: City of Diamondhead; authorize use of low-speed vehicles/golf carts on certain public highways, roads and streets in.
1669.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Diamondhead, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City Of Diamondhead; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; To Require Certain Registration Of Such Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart; And For Related Purposes.

1670.title: City of Hernando; authorize contribution to Hernando Civic Center, Inc., and/or Hernando Youth Sports, Inc.
1670.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hernando, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Hernando Civic Center And Hernando Youth Sports Through Calendar Year 2016 So Long As The Donated Funds Are To Be Utilized To Operate, Maintain And Improve Or Manage The Hernando Civic Center As A Public Park; And For Related Purposes.

1671.title: City of West Point; authorize tax levy on hotels, motels and restaurants for community and economic development and tourism.
1671.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of West Point, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1672.title: City of Oxford; authorize contributions to the Oxford-Lafayette County Economic Development Foundation.
1672.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Oxford-lafayette County Economic Development Foundation For The Next Three Municipal Fiscal Years; And For Related Purposes.

1673.title: City of Holly Springs; authorize the levy of a city sales tax.
1673.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; And For Related Purposes.

1674.title: City of Oxford; authorize to operate a farmers' market.
1674.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Expend Funds, Establish, Maintain, Repair And Operate A Farmers' Market; To Provide That The Governing Authorities May Allow The Operation Of The Farmers' Market On City-owned Property Or Property Procured For Such Purpose; To Authorize The City Of Oxford's Park Commission To Contribute Funds Or Employ Personnel To Manage Or Operate The Farmers' Market; And For Related Purposes.

1675.title: City of Oxford; authorize to utilize the "dual phase design-build" method of contracting for tennis complex.
1675.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Oxford, Mississippi, To Utilize The "dual Phase Design-build Method" Of Contracting For The Building And/or Expansion Of A Tennis Complex; And For Related Purposes.

1676.title: City of Ridgeland; authorize the city to levy an additional sales tax for certain purposes.
1676.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The Municipality Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Special Sales Tax Authorized By This Act; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 3/5 Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That A Certain Economic Analysis Study Be Conducted Before The Election And That Such Study Be Made Available To The Public; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax May Be Used And Expended; And For Related Purposes.

1677.title: Suffrage; restore to Charles L. Bone of Chickasaw County.
1677.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Charles L. Bone Of Chickasaw County, Mississippi.

1678.title: Suffrage; Restore to Verdell Judd of Chickasaw County.
1678.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Verdell Judd Of Chickasaw County, Mississippi.

1679.title: Sebastopol Natural Gas District; expand the boundaries of.
1679.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 998, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 943, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Expand The Boundaries Of The Sebastopol Natural Gas District; And For Related Purposes.

1680.title: City of Gautier; authorize to impose a tax on restaurants, bars, hotels and motels to promote tourism and economic development.
1680.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional 1% Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Bars And Upon Room Rentals Of Hotels And Motels; To Provide For An Indirect Referendum On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1681.title: City of Senatobia; authorize to impose tourism tax upon hotels, motels and restaurants.
1681.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Senatobia, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Promote Tourism; And For Related Purposes.

1682.title: City of Oxford; make certain revisions to the City of Oxford Municipal Reserve and Trust Fund.
1682.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 938, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Provide That Nongovernmental Trustee Members Of The City Of Oxford Municipal Reserve And Trust Fund Shall No Longer Receive Per Diem; To Provide That The Trustees Of The Fund Shall Manage Income Of The Fund Rather Than Interest Income; To Define The Earnings Component As 3% Every Fiscal Year Rather Than Just The First 3 Fiscal Years; To Provide That Such Earnings Component Shall Be Equal To 3% Of The Amount Of The Full Fund Balance Whether Or Not The Corpus Component Has Generated Any Income That Fiscal Year; To Provide That All Remaining Portions Of The Annual Income Earned From The Investment Of The Fund Shall Remain In The Fund As Part Of The Corpus Component; And For Related Purposes.

1683.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize to levy a sales tax upon all retail sales and services for a sports complex.
1683.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Levy A Five-tenths Percent Sales Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of All Retail Sales And Services; To Provide Revenues Not To Exceed Twenty Million Dollars From The Tax To Be Expended By The City To Provide For A Sports Complex And Recreational Facilities And Other Related Amenities; To Provide For A Direct Referendum On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1684.title: Covington County; authorize to use industrial park land for the construction of a county jail.
1684.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Covington County, Mississippi, To Use Its Industrial Park Land And Buildings For The Location And Construction Of A County Jail; And For Related Purposes.

1685.title: Coahoma County; authorize certain interfund loans to facilitate the construction of a county jail.
1685.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 919, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Amended By Chapter 927, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Make Interfund Loans From The County Special Fund Created To Deposit Funds Received By The County As A Result Of The Lease Of The Northwest Mississippi Regional Medical Center To Facilitate Construction Of A New County Jail; To Provide That The Loans May Be Made To The North Delta Public Improvements Corporation; To Authorize The County To Enter Into A Lease-purchase Agreement Whereby The North Delta Public Improvements Corporation Will Agree To Lease The Jail To The County For Purchase By The County At The Conclusion Of The Lease Term; To Establish A Maximum Amount The County May Loan From The County Special Fund For Construction Of The Jail; To Establish The Loan Repayment Term; And For Related Purposes.

1686.title: Suffrage; restore to Ira J. Banks of Amite County.
1686.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Ira James Banks Of Amite County, Mississippi.

1687.title: Suffrage; restore to Curtis Owens, Jr., of Covington county.
1687.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Curtis Owens, Jr., Of Covington County, Mississippi.

1688.title: Coahoma County; authorize to construct county jail anywhere in county.
1688.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Construct A New County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1689.title: Harrison County Motor Vehicle for Hire Commission; extend repealer on.
1689.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2010, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From December 31, 2012, To January 31, 2013, On The Harrison County Motor Vehicle For Hire Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1690.title: Lowndes County; authorize the transfer of real property between the county, the county industrial development authority and the economic development district.
1690.description: An Act To Authorize The Lowndes County Board Of Supervisors, The Lowndes County Industrial Development Authority, And/or The Lowndes County Economic Development District To Transfer Any Real Property And/or Improvements Thereon Amongst And Between Each And All Of Them; And For Related Purposes.

1691.title: Lowndes County School District; authorize to enter into a certain agreement for the management of district's lagoon system.
1691.description: An Act To Authorize The Lowndes County School District To Enter Into An Agreement With A Certain Private Enterprise To Manage And Operate The District's Sewage Lagoon/sewage System; To Authorize The District To Bill And Charge Private Individuals Who Utilize Such Sewage Lagoon/sewage System; And For Related Purposes.

1692.title: Marshall County; change name of Cayce Community Sewer District to Marshall Utility Services Sewer District.
1692.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 947, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Change The Name Of The Cayce Community Sewer District To The Marshall Utility Services Sewer District; And For Related Purposes.

1795.title: Booneville High School Dance Team; commend upon winning 2011 MHSAA 3A State High Kick Championship.
1795.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Booneville High School Dance Team For Winning The 2011 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 3a State High Kick Championship.

1796.title: Coach Wert Spiva; commend upon being named Boys Basketball Coach of the Year.
1796.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. Wert Spiva, Coach Of The Coldwater High School Boys Basketball Team, On Being Named Coach Of The Year By The Clarion-ledger.

1797.title: Mississippi Home Education Week; designate week of May 14-18, 2012, as in the State of MS.
1797.description: A Resolution Recognizing Mississippi's Unwavering Commitment To Education In The Designation Of The Week Of May 14-18, 2012, As Mississippi Home Education Week In The State Of Mississippi.

1798.title: Mrs. Jessie Polly Holloway Beverly; commemorate life and legacy upon her passing.
1798.description: A Resolution Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Service Of Mrs. Jessie Polly Holloway Beverly And Expressing Deepest Sympathy

1799.title: Coldwater High School Boys Basketball Team; commend upon winning class 1A State Championship.
1799.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Coldwater High School Cougars Boys Basketball Team And Head Coach Wert Spiva, Jr., For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 1a State Championship.

1800.title: Jerontay Clemons; commend upon being declared 2012 Miss Basketball.
1800.description: A Resolution Commending Jerontay Clemons Of The Coldwater High School Girls Basketball Team On Being Named 2012 Miss Basketball By The Clarion-ledger As Mississippi's Top Girls Player.

1801.title: Coach Woody Barnett; commend upon being named 2011 Athletic Director of the Year and the Boys Track Coach of the Year.
1801.description: A Resolution Commending Mr. Woody Barnett, Athletic Director And Head Track Coach Of Pearl High School, For Being Awarded The 2011 State Athletic Director Of The Year And Boys Track Coach Of The Year.

1802.title: Monica Edwards; commend upon her receiving the Alan R. Barton excellence in Teaching Award by Mississippi Power.
1802.description: A Resolution Commending Monica Edwards Of Greene County High School Upon Being Awarded The Alan R. Barton Excellence In Teaching Award.

1803.title: Mrs. Fannie Bradford; commend for 28 years of service as Scott County election commissioner and congratulate upon retirement.
1803.description: A Resolution Commending Mrs. Fannie Bradford For 28 Years Of Dedicated Service As A District One Election Commissioner For Scott County.

1804.title: Haywood Reeves; commend upon retirement after 44 years in education.
1804.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Lifelong Educator Haywood Reeves Of East Central Community College Upon His Retirement.

1805.title: Union Grove Community; commend upon winning 2nd place in Mississippi's annual Keep Mississippi Beautiful Competition.
1805.description: A Resolution Congratulating Union Grove Community For Winning Second Place In Mississippi's Annual Keep Mississippi Beautiful Competition In 2012.

1806.title: Meridian High School Academic Team; commend upon winning Faber Classic.
1806.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Meridian High School Academic Team For Winning The Prestigious Faber Classic Hosted By St. Andrew's Episcopal School In Ridgeland, Mississippi.

1807.title: Al Hall; commend success as African-American Poet.
1807.description: A Resolution Commending The Impressive And Noteworthy Success Of Prentiss, Mississippi, Native, Mr. Al Hall, As An African-american Poet.

1808.title: Charleston High School Lady Tigers Powerlifting Team; commend upon winning Class 3A State Championship.
1808.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Charleston High School Lady Tigers Powerlifting Team For Their Outstanding 2011-2012 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 3a State Championship For The Third Consecutive Year.

1809.title: Etta Ann Bowie; commend service as Justice Court Judge of Choctaw County for 28 years (1984-2012).
1809.description: A Resolution Commending The Impressive And Dedicated Career Of Judge Etta Ann Bowie Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement After 28 Years Of Public Service As A Justice Court Judge Of Choctaw County, Mississippi.

1810.title: Coach Joe Walker; commend upon retirement as Ole Miss Track & Field Coach.
1810.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Joe Walker Upon His Retirement From The University Of Mississippi After 30 Years As The Head Coach Of The Track And Field Team.

1811.title: Thomas Higgins; commend service as a Choctaw County Supervisor upon the occasion of his retirement.
1811.description: A Resolution Commending The Legacy And Unmatched Public Service Of Longstanding Choctaw County Supervisor Thomas Higgins And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1812.title: First African-American Troopers of the MS Highway Safety Patrol; acknowledge service and legacy of upon the 40th anniversary of.
1812.description: A Resolution Acknowledging The 40th Anniversary Of The First African-american Troopers Commissioned To The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol.

1813.title: Stephan M. Nelson; commend upon election as President of Phi Kappa Tau National Fraternity.
1813.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Stephan M. Nelson Upon Being Elected By Acclamation As The 46th President Of The Phi Kappa Tau National Fraternity And Acknowledging His Upcoming Installation To Office During The National Convention In Nashville, Tennessee, On July 25-29, 2012.

1814.title: Representative Harvey Moss; commend dedicated legislative career upon retirement from House of Representatives.
1814.description: A Resolution Commending Representative Harvey Moss For His Legislative Legacy And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Mississippi House Of Representatives.

1815.title: Governor-elect Phil Bryant; appoint joint committee to arrange inauguration of.
1815.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For The Appointment Of A Joint Committee Of The Legislature To Arrange For The Inauguration Of Governor-elect Phil Bryant.

1816.title: Joint Session; provide for inauguration and to hear message of Governor Phil Bryant.
1816.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The House Of Representatives And The Senate On January 10, 2012, For The Inauguration And To Hear The Message Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1817.title: Joint session; call to hear State of the State address of the Governor.
1817.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1818.title: Lee Boozer; commend and congratulate upon retirement as Principal of Ridgeland High School.
1818.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Lee Boozer, Affectionately Known As "mr. Ridgeland High," Upon His Retirement After 10 Years As Principal Of Ridgeland High School.

1819.title: Austin Davis; commending and congratulating on being awarded the Conerly & Burlsworth Trophies.
1819.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Success And Athletic Accomplishments Of The University Of Southern Mississippi Golden Eagles Quarterback Austin Davis Upon Being Named Recipient Of The 2011 C-spire Wireless Conerly Trophy And The 2011 Burlsworth Trophy.

1820.title: Picayune High School Football Team; commend for winning championship.
1820.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Picayune High School Maroon Tide Football Team And Veteran Head Coach Dodd Lee For Their Outstanding 2010-2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 5a State Championship.

1821.title: Feb. 8, 1954; recognizing the anniversary of, "under God," added to the U.S. Pledge of Allegiance.
1821.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing February 8, 1954, As The Anniversary Of The Addition Of The Words, "under God," To The United States Pledge Of Allegiance.

1822.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend for purpose of adding parental rights amendment.
1822.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Parental Rights And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1823.title: Kossuth High School; commend and congratulate on perfect football season.
1823.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Kossuth High School Aggies Football Team And Head Coach Brian Kelly On Their Outstanding 2011 Winning Season.

1824.title: Ellis Johnson; commend & congratulate upon hiring as USM Head Coach.
1824.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Ellis Johnson Upon His Hiring As The Head Coach Of The University Of Southern Mississippi Golden Eagles Football Team.

1825.title: USM Football Team; commend and congratulate on outstanding 2011 season.
1825.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The University Of Southern Mississippi Golden Eagles Football Team On Their Outstanding 2011 Season, Finishing With A 12-2 Overall Record And Ranked No. 21 In The Bcs Standings.

1826.title: MS Children's Home Services; commend upon celebration of its centennial anniversary.
1826.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The 100th Anniversary Of Mississippi Children's Home Services And Commending Their Service And Dedication To Mississippi's Children And Families And Recognizing January 25, 2012, As Mississippi Children's Home Services Recognition Day.

1827.title: John Craven; commend and congratulate upon being named State Assistant Principal of the year.
1827.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating John Craven For Being Selected By The Mississippi Association Of Secondary School Principals As Assistant Principal Of The Year.

1828.title: Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College; commemorate the centennial anniversary of.
1828.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The Centennial Anniversary Of Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College And Congratulating The Institution For Its Distinguished Legacy Of Excellence In Post-secondary Educational Advancements.

1829.title: Vick Ballard; commend and congratulate upon being named Music City Bowl MVP.
1829.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Vick Ballard Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, On Being Selected As The Most Valuable Player In The 2011 Music City Bowl.

1830.title: National Debt Relief Amendment; apply for amendments convention to the Constitution for passage of.
1830.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For The Application For An Amendments Convention To The Constitution Of The United States To Be Called For The Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment That Provides That An Increase In The Federal Debt Requires Approval From A Majority Of The Legislatures Of The Separate States.

1831.title: Pearl High School Marching Band; commend and congratulate on winning the 2011 Class 5A State Championship.
1831.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl High School Pirate Marching Band Under The Direction Of Jeff Cannon Upon Winning The Class 5a Mississippi High School Activities Association State Marching Band Championship.

1832.title: Northwest Rankin High School Dance Team; commend upon winning Class 6A State Championship in Jazz.
1832.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2011-2012 Northwest Rankin High School Dance Team For Winning The 2011 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Jazz Championship.

1833.title: Brandon High School Dance Team; commend upon winning Class 6A State Championship in Hip-Hop.
1833.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2011-2012 Brandon High School Dance Team For Winning The 2011 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Hip-hop Championship.

1834.title: Loretta Claiborne and Special Olympics MS Athletes; commend achievements of.
1834.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Special Olympics Athletes Of Mississippi For Their Outstanding Achievements In Athletics And Welcoming Special Olympian Loretta Claiborne To Our State.

1835.title: Arthur "Bubba" Lawler; commend life and service of upon his passing.
1835.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Former Issaquena County Sheriff Arthur "bubba" Lawler, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1836.title: Express opposition to provisions of National Defense Authorization Act of 2012.
1836.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing Opposition To Provisions Of The National Defense Authorization Act Of 2012.

1837.title: Cleveland Donald, Jr.; commend life and legacy of Civil Rights leader and activist.
1837.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Cleveland Donald, Jr., And Extending Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1838.title: Booneville High School Marching Band; commend and congratulate on winning Class 3A Championship.
1838.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Booneville High School Blue Devil Marching Band Under The Direction Of John And Lora Emerson Upon Winning The Class 3a Mississippi High School Activities Association State Marching Band Championship.

1839.title: Battle of Farmington; recognize 150th anniversary of.
1839.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 150th Anniversary

1840.title: Lafayette High School Football Team; commend, congratulate on perfect season and MHSAA 4A title.
1840.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lafayette High School Football Team And Head Coach Anthony Hart For Their Outstanding 2011 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a State Championship.

1841.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit the Governor from granting a pardon or reprieve within the last 90 days of office.
1841.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Prohibit The Governor From Granting A Pardon Or Reprieve Within The Last 90 Days Of The Governor's Term Of Office; To Provide That The Legislature May By General Law Require The Governor To Notify Certain Officials And Other Persons Before The Governor May Exercise The Power To Grant A Reprieve Or Pardon; And For Related Purposes.

1842.title: Constitution; amend to lower vote requirement from 3/5 to majority for passage of a bill that reduces a tax.
1842.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 70, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Vote Requirement For The Passage Of A Bill That Reduces A Tax Is Only A Majority Vote Of Each House Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1843.title: Constitution; amend to establish right to hunt, fish and trap.
1843.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Adding A New Section Establishing The Right To Hunt, Fish And Trap Wildlife And Fish As A Constitutional Right; And For Related Purposes.

1844.title: Constitution; establish right to hunt, fish and harvest wildlife.
1844.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Adding A New Section 12a To Establish The Right To Hunt, Fish And Harvest Wildlife As A Constitutional Right; And For Related Purposes.

1845.title: Alcorn State University Baseball Team; commend & congratulate on 2011 SWAC Championship & NCAA appearance.
1845.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Alcorn State University Braves Baseball Team And Head Coach Barret Rey For Alcorn's First Ever Baseball Championship In The Southwestern Athletic Conference And For Their Excellent 2011 Regular Season And First Ncaa Regional Appearance.

1846.title: Wesley K. Beasley; commend and congratulate upon achievement of Eagle Scout.
1846.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Wesley Keith Beasley On Achieving The Honor Of The Eagle Scout Award And Being Celebrated At The Distinguished Eagle Court Of Honor Ceremony.

1847.title: Joint Rules; adopt for 2012-2016 term.
1847.description: A Concurrent Resolution Adopting Joint Rules Of The Senate And The House Of Representatives For The 2012-2016 Term Of The Mississippi Legislature.

1848.title: Constitution; amend to set forth composition of PERS board of trustees.
1848.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing A New Section 272b, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Set Forth The Composition Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Public Employees' Retirement System; And For Related Purposes.

1849.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend regarding prayer in schools.
1849.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Prayer In Public Schools And Urging And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1850.title: Constitution; amend to authorize metropolitan government.
1850.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Law And To Permit The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Law Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1851.title: State of poverty in Mississippi; acknowledge need for improved economic viability and increased awareness.
1851.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The State Of Poverty In The State Of Mississippi, Recognizing The State's 20 Poorest Counties And Their Impact On The Overall Status Of Our State, And Encouraging The Improvement Of Their Economic Viability Through Increased Awareness And Creation Of Opportunity By Emphasizing The Importance Of The Inter-relationship With All 82 Counties As It Relates To The Social And Economic Rankings In The State Of Mississippi.

1852.title: State appointments, certain; urge to reflect more of the demographics and diversity of the state.
1852.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging That State Appointments For Agency Directors, Commissioners And Boards Be More Reflective Of The Demographics And Diversity Of The State Of Mississippi.

1853.title: State of Mississippi; urge to take critical and fundamental actions to improve the state's economic and social rankings.
1853.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Economic And Social Rankings And Encouraging Mississippi Agencies, And Public And Private Entities To Take Critical And Fundamental Actions To Improve Mississippi's Economic And Social Rankings.

1854.title: Hugh Freeze; commend and congratulate upon being named Ole Miss Head Coach of Football.
1854.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Hugh Freeze Upon His Hiring As The Head Coach Of The University Of Mississippi Rebels Football Team.

1855.title: Easton Curry; commend & congratulate on being named State Games of MS Athlete of the Year.
1855.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Easton Curry Upon Being Selected The State Games Of Mississippi At&t Male Athlete Of The Year.

1856.title: Kristi Voss; commend and congratulate upon being named 2011 State Games of MS Female Athlete of the Year.
1856.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Kristi Voss On Being Selected As The 2011 State Games Of Mississippi At&t Female Athlete Of The Year.

1857.title: Constitution; amend to provide that minimum age to serve in Mississippi State Senate is 18 years.
1857.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From 25 To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1858.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1858.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Sections 140 And 142 And Repealing Section 141 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1859.title: Constitution; amend to provide that minimum age to serve in Mississippi House of Representatives is 18 years.
1859.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From 21 Years To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1860.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit laws compelling any person, employer or health care provider to participate in any health care plan.
1860.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Creating A New Section To Prohibit Laws Or Rules From Compelling Any Person, Employer Or Health Care Provider To Participate In Any Health Care System; To Permit A Person Or Employer To Pay Directly For Lawful Health Care Services And To Permit A Health Care Provider To Accept Direct Payment From A Person Or Employer For Lawful Health Care Services; To Provide That The Purchase Or Sale Of Health Insurance Shall Not Be Prohibited By Law Or Rule; And For Related Purposes.

1861.title: Constitution; amend to provide that Legislature shall meet in regular session once every two years.
1861.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2014, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; And For Related Purposes.

1862.title: Constitution; amend to change day of November statewide general election from Tuesday to Saturday.
1862.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day On Which The Election Of Statewide Officers Occurs From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1863.title: Joint Rules; amend to require a 2/3 vote on bills that adversely affect benefits of members of PERS.
1863.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Adopt A New Joint Rule No. 21a To Provide That No Bill, Conference Committee Report, Or Concurrence In Amendments Adopted By The Other House, That Adversely Affects Benefits Or Employee Contribution Rates For Members Or Beneficiaries Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Of Mississippi Shall Be Passed Or Adopted By Either The Senate Or House Except By A Vote Of At Least Two-thirds Of The Members Of That House Present And Voting; And For Related Purposes.

1864.title: First African-American female judges in Mississippi; honor and recognize.
1864.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring Chancellor Denise Owens, Chancellor Patricia Wise, Judge Betty W. Sanders, Judge Lillie Sanders And Judge Ermea J. Russell As The First African-american Female Judges In The State Of Mississippi.

1865.title: Dr. Onous Wells; commend and congratulate upon the occasion of his retirement.
1865.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Onous Wells Upon His Retirement After 50 Years Of Providing Dental Services To Mississippi.

1866.title: Slavery; issue apology for state's role in upholding and perpetuating in Mississippi.
1866.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, Expressing Profound Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, The Discrimination Of Its Legacy And Urging Reconciliation.

1867.title: Brandon High School Lady Bulldogs Soccer Team; commend upon winning Class 6A State Championship.
1867.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Brandon High School Lady Bulldogs Soccer Team And Head Coach Celeste Bramlett For Their Outstanding 2011-2012 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Championship.

1868.title: Eli Manning; commend and congratulate upon being named MVP of Super Bowl XLVI.
1868.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating New York Giants Quarterback Elisha Nelson "eli" Manning On Being Selected As The Most Valuable Player In Super Bowl Xlvi.

1869.title: Constitution; require local and private bill proposing tax to provide for direct referendum on question of imposing the tax.
1869.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 89, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That If A Local And Private Bill Proposes To Impose, Increase Or Extend A Tax Of Any Kind Within A Specific Governmental Entity, Locality Or Area, Then The Bill Shall Provide For A Direct Referendum To Be Held On The Question Of Imposing, Increasing Or Extending The Tax; To Provide That The Referendum Shall Be Held At The Same Time As The Next Regularly Scheduled Election In The Area; And For Related Purposes.

1870.title: Oliver Joseph Nash; commend & congratulate upon receiving Eagle Scout honor.
1870.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Oliver Joseph Nash On Achieving The Honor Of The Eagle Scout Award And Being Celebrated At The Distinguished Eagle Court Of Honor Ceremony.

1871.title: Constitution; amend to require a majority vote only for bill reducing taxes.
1871.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 70, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Bills That Reduce Taxes Require Only A Majority Vote For Passage; And For Related Purposes.

1872.title: Constitution; amend to require State Parole Board recommendation before Governor may pardon person convicted of felony crime.
1872.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require That The Governor May Not Grant A Pardon To A Person Convicted Of A Felony Crime Until The State Parole Board Has Recommended That The Pardon Be Granted And Has Provided A Copy Of The Recommendation To Any Victim Of The Felony Crime; And For Related Purposes.

1873.title: Maxine Parrott Lindsey; commend dedicated service of.
1873.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedication And Service Of Maxine Parrott Lindsey.

1874.title: Constitution; amend to provide for a state university system state board of governors and local board of trustees.
1874.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi; To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System; To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1875.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the right to life is a fundamental right and "person" applies to all humans from conception.
1875.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Article 3 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 32a To Provide That The Right To Life Is The Paramount And Most Fundamental Right Of A Person; To Provide That The Word "person" Applies To All Human Beings From Conception To Natural Death, With A Certain Exception; To Specify Certain Activities That Are Not Affected Or Prohibited By This Section, Including Contraception Or Birth Control Not Killing A Person, In Vitro Fertilization Or Other Methods Of Reproduction, Medical Treatment Intended To Preserve Life, Or Miscarriage; And For Related Purposes.

1876.title: Constitution; corporation shall not have any right or privilege granted to the people or an individual person.
1876.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 32, 181, 182 And 199, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Corporation Shall Not Have Any Right Or Privilege Granted To The People Or To An Individual Person; To Provide That A Corporation Shall Not Receive A Property Or Income Tax Credit, Deduction Or Exemption That Is Not Allowed To An Individual Person; And For Related Purposes.

1877.title: Constitution; amend to prohibit Governor from granting a pardon or reprieve within the last 90 days of office.
1877.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Prohibit The Governor From Granting A Pardon Or Reprieve Within The Last 90 Days Of The Governor's Term Of Office; And For Related Purposes.

1878.title: Constitution; amend to include manslaughter in list of crimes disqualifying a person as an elector.
1878.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Add Manslaughter To The Enumeration Of Specific Offenses, Conviction Of Which Will Preclude A Person From Being Declared A Qualified Elector; And For Related Purposes.

1879.title: Constitution; amend to require Governor to give Legislature advance notice of extraordinary session.
1879.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require A Proclamation Which Calls The Legislature Into Extraordinary Session To Be Issued At Least Five Calendar Days Before The Convening Of The Legislature In Extraordinary Session; And For Related Purposes.

1880.title: Constitution; amend to authorize IHL Board to contract with certain university employees for up to 10 years.
1880.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213-a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Contract With An Employee Of Any Institution Who Has A Supplemental Compensation Agreement With A Private Foundation For A Term Not Exceeding Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1881.title: Constitution; amend to require actual cause or physical evidence before a search warrant is issued.
1881.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 23, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Search Warrant Shall Only Be Issued For Actual Cause Or Physical Evidence Instead Of Probable Cause; And For Related Purposes.

1882.title: Congress; urge to amend federal law to require removal of negative information from credit report after four years.
1882.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging Congress To Amend The Federal Fair Credit Reporting Act To Require Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies To Remove Accurate But Negative Information From A Person's Credit Report After Four Years.

1883.title: Constitution; provide that defense of double jeopardy shall not be an available defense to person accused of killing an unarmed person.
1883.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 22, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Defense Of Double Jeopardy, Which Protects A Person Against A Second Prosecution For The Same Offense After Acquittal Or Conviction And Against Multiple Punishments For The Same Offense, Shall Not Be An Available Defense To Any Person Who Is Accused Of Killing An Unarmed Person; And For Related Purposes.

1884.title: U.S. Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend 5th Amendment relative to double jeopardy.
1884.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To The Double Jeopardy Clause Of The Fifth Amendment And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1885.title: Constitution; amend to elect State Superintendent of Public Education.
1885.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Election Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education Beginning At The General State Election In 2015.

1886.title: Carrie Jones Golf Day; recognize March 21, 2012, as.
1886.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Carrie Jones For Her Many Historic Contributions To The Sport Of Golf And Recognizing March 21, 2012, As Carrie Jones Golf Day.

1887.title: Constitution; revise provision allowing for a bill to be read in full immediately before the vote on its final passage.
1887.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 59, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Revise The Provision Allowing For A Bill To Be Read In Full Immediately Before The Vote On Its Final Passage; To Change The Procedure To Follow Before The Bill Is Read From A Requirement That Any One Member May Demand That The Bill Be Read, To A Requirement That A Motion Be Adopted By A Majority Vote Of The Members Of The House Present And Voting Before The Bill Is Read; And For Related Purposes.

1888.title: Constitution; establish legal holidays of African American Day and of Women's Day.
1888.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Establish Two Legal Holidays In The Constitution, In Addition To Those Which May Be Provided By The Legislature In General Law; To Designate The Last Day Of February As "african American Day" And August 26 As "women's Day"; And For Related Purposes.

1889.title: Constitution; allow citizen to request drafting of bill and create new criminal offenses regarding conduct of law enforcement and judicial officers.
1889.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 56 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Allow A Qualified Elector With Certain Educational Qualifications To Request That A Proposed Bill Be Drafted By The Applicable Legal Offices Of The State Senate And The House Of Representatives; To Add A New Section To Create New Criminal Offenses Related To The Conduct Of A Law Enforcement Officer, Attorney, District Attorney, Prosecuting Attorney Or Judge; And For Related Purposes.

1890.title: Constitution; amend to establish countywide school districts with elected school boards & appointed superintendents.
1890.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Add A New Section 201a And To Amend Section 204 And Section 206, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That, Beginning On July 1, 2016, There Shall Be One Countywide School District In Each County Of The State Which Shall Be Governed By An Elected School Board That Shall Appoint A School District Superintendent; And For Related Purposes.

1891.title: Constitution; repeal Governor's authority to grant reprieves and pardons in criminal cases.
1891.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Repeal Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Allows The Governor To Grant Reprieves And Pardons In Criminal Cases; And For Related Purposes.

1892.title: Constitution; dedicate certain percentage of General Fund to repair and renovation of state-owned properties.
1892.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Adding A New Section That Provides For The Necessary Maintenance And Capital Improvement Of State-owned Properties; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury, Into Which Shall Be Deposited One Percent Of The Unencumbered Cash Balance In The General Fund At The Close Of Each Fiscal Year, Beginning On July 1, 2015; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund Can Only Be Used For Capital Improvements And Repair And Renovation Of State-owned Properties; And For Related Purposes.

1893.title: States' sovereignty; affirm based on constitutional principles.
1893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Affirming The Sovereignty Of The States Based On Constitutional Principles Of The United States Constitution.

1894.title: Constitution; amend to create section to provide that right to abortion is not constitutionally protected.
1894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Article 3 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 32a To Provide That The Right To Life Is The Paramount And Most Fundamental Right Of A Person With A Certain Exception; To Provide That The Rights To Autonomous Bodily Integrity And To Privacy Do Not Explicitly Or Implicitly Include The Right To Abortion; To Provide That The Word "person" Applies To All Human Beings From Conception To Natural Death; To Specify The Activities That Are Not Affected By This Section; And For Related Purposes.

1895.title: Dr. Carolyn W. Meyers; commend for dedicated service as President of Jackson State University.
1895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedicated Service Of Dr. Carolyn W. Meyers As President Of Jackson State University.

1896.title: Constitution; automatically restore suffrage to persons convicted of certain offenses upon completing sentence and other conditions.
1896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 253 And 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Disqualified As An Elector By Reason Of Conviction Of Certain Felony Offenses Shall Have His Right To Vote Restored Automatically Upon Completion Of His Sentence, Probation, Parole And Any Other Conditions As The Legislature, May Prescribe By General Law; And For Related Purposes.

1897.title: Constitution; provide that it shall not be construed to grant to any person the right to choose to have an abortion.
1897.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 32, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Nothing In The Constitution Shall Be Construed To Grant To Any Person The Right To Choose To Have An Abortion; And For Related Purposes.

1898.title: Adrian Grice; commend dedication and service of upon his retirement.
1898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedication And Service Of Adrian Grice Upon His Retirement As Executive Director Of The Mississippi Veterans Affairs Board.

1899.title: Republic of Azerbaijan; recognizing 20 years of diplomatic relations with the United States of America.
1899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Twenty Years Of Diplomatic Relations Between The United States Of America And The Republic Of Azerbaijan.

1900.title: Malcolm Kuykendall; congratulate upon retirement.
1900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Remarkable And Dedicated Service Of Malcolm Kuykendall As Superintendent Of The Tishomingo County School District And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1901.title: Rusty Walker; commend & congratulate upon induction into Country Radio Hall of Fame.
1901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi's Own Sammy Darwin Upon His Induction Into The Country Radio Hall Of Fame.
