2659.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Job Protection Act Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Existing Industry Productivity Loan Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $331,500,000.00 To $346,500,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $40,100,000.00 To $55,100,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $40,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; And For Related Purposes.

2660.title: Headquarters sales tax and job tax credit; lower jobs number for exemption and Dept. of Revenue shall establish criteria for credit.
2660.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Lower To 20 The Number Of Jobs That Must Be Created At The Headquarters Of A Company Transferring Or Establishing Its National Or Regional Headquarters From Within Or Without This State In Order For The Company To Be Eligible For The Sales Tax Exemption On Sales Of Component Materials Used In The Construction Of, Or Improvements To, Its Headquarters Building; To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Department Of Revenue, Rather Than The Mississippi Development Authority, Shall Establish Criteria And Prescribe Procedures To Determine If A Company Qualifies As A National Or Regional Headquarters For The Purpose Of Receiving The Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2663.title: Any time spent by offenders under field supervision of the Community Services Division of DOC; require credit toward sentences of.
2663.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Time Served By An Offender On Probation, Parole, Earned-release Supervision, Post-release Supervision, Earned Probation Or Any Other Offender Under Field Supervision Of The Community Services Division Of The Department Of Corrections Shall Be Credited Toward The Service Of The Sentence Of The Offender; To Remove The Date Of Repeal On This Section; And For Related Purposes.

2664.title: Parole; offenders to receive credit on original sentence for time served on parole prior to revocation.
2664.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Time Served By An Offender On Parole Shall Be Credited Toward The Service Of His Or Her Sentence Until Parole Revocation Is Final; And For Related Purposes.

2667.title: Office of Public Assistance Inspector General; establish.
2667.description: An Act To Establish And Empower The Office Of Public Assistance Inspector General; To Prescribe Qualifications For The Public Assistance Inspector General; To Prescribe The Duties And Responsibilities Of The Office Of Public Assistance Inspector General Relative To The Investigation, Reporting And Prosecuting Of Public Assistance Fraud And Misrepresentation; To Grant Subpoena Power To The Public Assistance Inspector General; To Provide A Complaints Procedure; To Prohibit Disclosure Of Confidential Information; To Amend Sections 25-9-171, 33-15-43, 43-1-23, 43-13-129, 43-13-131, 43-13-219, 43-13-221, 43-13-227, 43-13-229, 43-13-231, 43-17-25, 43-33-16, 43-47-37, 71-5-17 And 71-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Authorize The Public Assistance Inspector General To Investigate And Prosecute Cases Of Medicaid, Tanf, Unemployment Compensation And Housing Assistance Fraud; And In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2668.title: Public Records Act; public access will not be diminished because records are stored in certain manner/revise civil penalty.
2668.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Records Act To Clarify That Public Access To A Public Record Will Not Be Diminished Because Components Of Data Are Stored In A Certain Manner; To Amend Section 25-61-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Staff Time Or Contractual Services Included In Actual Cost Of Providing Records Shall Be At The Pay Scale Of The Lowest Level Employee Or Contractor Competent To Respond To The Request; To Amend Section 25-61-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Civil Penalty Against Any Person Who Charges An Unreasonable Fee For Providing A Public Record; And For Related Purposes.

2669.title: Public construction projects; require entities to have verifiable percentage goals for veteran business participation.
2669.description: An Act To Require Public Entities To Have Verifiable Percentage Goals For Veteran Business Participation In Public Construction Projects; To Provide That Public Entities Shall Require Contractors To Make Good Faith Efforts To Meet The Veteran Business Participation; To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Public Entities To Set Aside A Certain Percentage Of Anticipated Annual Expenditures For The Purchase Of Commodities From Veteran Businesses; And For Related Purposes.

2670.title: State agencies; prohibit radio and TV advertising to promote agency programs except in certain instances.
2670.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-9-120.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit State Agencies From Using Radio And Television Advertising To Promote Agency Programs, Except In Certain Instances; To Create A New Section To Prohibit The Institutions Of Higher Learning From Using Appropriated Funds For Advertising Programs; To Amend Section 25-9-120, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Bidding Of Agency Advertising Contracts, And To Provide A Procedure For Bidding Contracts For Television And Radio Advertising When Procured With Federal Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2671.title: Low-performing schools and school districts; authorize State Board of Education to consolidate in emergency situations.
2671.description: An Act Relating To Low-performing Schools And School Districts; To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Local School District Violates Accreditation Standards Determined To Be The Basis For Immediate Withdrawal Of Accreditation, There Shall Be A Show Cause Hearing Conducted By The Commission On School Accreditation; To Authorize The Parent Or Guardian Of A Child Enrolled In A School District Whose Accreditation Has Been Withdrawn To Petition For A Transfer Into An Accredited School District And To Provide For The Transfer Of State Adequate Program Funds To The Transferee School District; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Abolish A School District And Administratively Consolidate With One Or More Existing School Districts In Emergency Situations With The Approval Of The Transferee School District; To Authorize Loans To School Districts Under Conservatorship From The School District Emergency Assistance Fund And To Provide That Such Fund Is A Special Fund Which Shall Not Lapse Into The State General Fund; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education And The State Department Of Education To Change The Performance Level Terminology For Schools And School Districts To "a", "b", "c", "d" And "f" Based On Established Benchmarks Of Student Achievement And Growth; To Provide That Such New Terminology For Accreditation Rating Purposes Shall Be Effective Upon Full Implementation Of Common Core State Standards And Assessments; To Amend Section 37-17-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Board Member Or Superintendent In Office At The Time The Governor Declares A State Of Emergency In A School District Shall Not Be Eligible To Serve In That Office In Such School District And To Provide That The New Superintendent In Such School District Shall Be Appointed; To Amend Section 37-5-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2672.title: Sixteenth section school land; leases presumed valid.
2672.description: An Act To Clarify That A Lease Of Sixteenth Section Lands That Is Duly Executed By The Applicable School Board Of The School District Is Presumed To Be Valid; To Clarify That The Approval Of The Secretary Of State Is Not Necessary Before The Board May Enter Into Any Such Lease; To Provide That The Secretary May Object To The Validity Of Such A Lease By Filing An Action In The Appropriate Chancery Court And Demonstrating That The Lease Is Unconscionable Or Otherwise Not Valid; To Provide That Board Members Acting In Good Faith Are Immune From Individual Liability Associated With Entering Into The Lease; To Amend Sections 29-3-63 And 29-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Section 29-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2674.title: State Longitudinal Data System (SLDS); reenact to develop interagency participation to link education with employment.
2674.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 37-154-1 And 37-154-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Development Of A State Longitudinal Data System (slds) On July 1, 2012; To Establish A Multiagency Database To Track Education And Student Outcomes In The Workforce; To Provide For Interagency Cooperation With The Slds; To Provide For A Slds Governing Board; And For Related Purposes.

2675.title: Government overpayment of tax dollars; authorize State Auditor to contract with consultants to conduct recovery audits for.
2675.description: An Act To Provide For Recovery Audits For Government Overpayments Of Tax Dollars; To Define Certain Terms; To Authorize The State Auditor To Contract With Private Consultants To Conduct Recovery Audits Of Payments Made By State Agencies To Individuals, Vendors And Other Entities; To Require Mandatory Recovery Audits On Payments To Individuals, Vendors And Other Entities Made By Certain Agencies; To Require The State Auditor To Provide To Certain State Officials Copies Of Any Recovery Audit Reports Received From The Private Consultants; To Authorize The State Auditor To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Implement This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2676.title: Public Purchasing Law; increase amounts for which competitive bid process is required.
2676.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Public Purchasing Law To Increase The Minimum Amount Of Expenditures For Which The Competitive Bid Process Is Required; And For Related Purposes.

2677.title: County purchases; increase threshold amount whereby certain paperwork is not required.
2677.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-103 And 31-7-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Threshold Amount Whereby Requisitions To Purchase, Purchase Orders And Receiving Reports Are Not Required For County Purchases; And For Related Purposes.

2678.title: Motor carriers; regulate indemnification agreements between motor carriers and shippers.
2678.description: An Act To Regulate Indemnification Agreements Between Motor Carriers And Shippers; And For Related Purposes.

2679.title: Disparity study; require MDA to file copies with the Legislature by not later than December 31, 2012.
2679.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To File With The Secretary Of The Senate And The Clerk Of The House Of Representatives By Not Later Than December 31, 2012, A Copy Of Its Study To Determine If There Is A Significant Statistical Disparity In The Total Number Of Qualified Minority Contractors Of Goods And Services Doing Business In The State Of Mississippi And The Actual Number Of Such Minority Contractors With Whom The State Of Mississippi, Or With Whom A Prime Contractor With The State Of Mississippi, Has Contracted To Provide Goods And Services; And For Related Purposes.

2680.title: Small business; require state agencies to file certain contracts with small businesses with MDA.
2680.description: An Act To Require State Agencies To File With The Mississippi Development Authority Copies Of All The Contracts That They Have Entered Into With Any Small Business Or Minority Business For The Procurement Of Goods Or Services For The Previous Fiscal Year; To Require Certain Other Information To Be Filed With Such Contracts; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Utilize Such Information To Prepare A Report Detailing The Participation Of Small Businesses And Minority Businesses In State Contracts For Such Fiscal Year; To Require Copies Of Such Report To Be Filed With The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2681.title: State Auditor; revise organizational structure for the divisions of the Department of Audit.
2681.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Organizational Structure For The Divisions Of The Department Of Audit; To Authorize The State Auditor To Contract For Any Service To Carry Out His Statutory Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2682.title: Department of ITS; authorize to manage state data centers for cost-sharing services to all agencies.
2682.description: An Act Relating To The Planning And Implementation Of The State's Information Technology Resources By The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services; To Amend Section 25-53-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare Legislative Intent; To Amend Section 25-53-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms; To Amend Section 25-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The Department Of Information Technology Services To Manage One Or More State Data Centers To Provide Information Technology Services On A Cost-sharing Basis To All State Agencies; To Direct The Department Of Information Technology Services To Increase Federal Participation In The State Data Center And Its Shared Technology Infrastructure; To Create A New Section To Direct The Department Of Information Technology Services To Conduct An Assessment Of Information Technology Assets In State Agencies And Make Recommendations For The Consolidation Of These Assets; To Amend Section 25-53-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2683.title: Public purchases; require state agencies to set-aside 5% of purchases of their commodities from small businesses.
2683.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each State Agency To Set Aside For Contracts With Small Businesses 5% Of Its Anticipated Annual Expenditures For Contracts To Which This Section Applies; To Require Such Purchases For Which Competitive Bids Are Required Shall Be Made From The Lowest And Best Small Business Bidder; And For Related Purposes.

2684.title: State Advisory Panel on Special Education; revise membership and duties.
2684.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi State Advisory Panel On Special Education And Prescribe Its Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2685.title: Students with disabilities; parents shall receive copy of outside evaluation and observation report, etc.
2685.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-23-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Shall Be Provided A Copy Of An Outside Entity's Assessment/evaluation And Observation Report; To Require That Parents Of A Child With A Disability Will Be Provided With A Copy Of Their Child's Initial Or Reevaluation Assessment Report Before An Iep Meeting; To Require That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Shall Be Provided A Copy Of Their Child's Alternate Assessment Scores At No Cost; To Provide That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Have The Option Of Tape Recording Their Child's Iep Meeting; To Amend Section 37-23-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Findings And Decisions Of The State Department Of Education Office Of Special Education Relative To A Parental Complaint Shall Be Forwarded To Each Member Of The Local School Board; To Revise Complaint Procedures To Require That Parents Of Students With Disabilities Shall Receive Certain Response Information; To Bring Forward Section 37-23-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Revises The Time Limitation For Bringing A Civil Action With Respect To A Student With Disabilities Due Process Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

2686.title: Coordinated School Health Pilot Program based on federal model; authorize SDE and SDH to establish.
2686.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-134, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Education And The State Department Of Health To Establish A School Health Pilot Program Based Upon Appropriate Science-based Wellness Policies; And For Related Purposes.

2688.title: Physician freedom of vaccine choice program; establish in State Department of Health.
2688.description: An Act To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Implement A Physician Choice System For Certain Vaccines For Children In Federal Programs; To Provide That The Department Shall Provide A Vaccine Selected By A Physician Only If The Cost To The Department Is Not More Than 115% Of The Lowest Priced Equivalent Vaccine; To Authorize The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Rules To Implement The Physician Choice Program; And For Related Purposes.

2690.title: State vendors procedures; authorize DFA to streamline certification of receipt of goods and services.
2690.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize State Vendors To Submit Invoices To A Central Data Location And To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Issue Regulations Regarding Verification Of Receipt Of Goods And Services; And For Related Purposes.

2691.title: State Auditor; establish a training course for local officials regarding interest rate agreement.
2691.description: An Act To Require The Chief Executive Officer And Chief Financial Officer Of A Governmental Entity To Obtain A Basic Understanding Of The Risks And Benefits Of Entering Into An Interest Rate Agreement And To Authorize Such Officers To Obtain Professional Advice To Help Analyze Such Risks And Benefits To The Extent They Deem Necessary; To Require The Chief Executive Officers Or The Chief Financial Officers To Attend Educational Training Courses Established By The State Auditor Regarding Interest Rate Agreements Established By The State Auditor Prior To Submitting A Bond Financing Review Form To The State Auditor's Office; To Authorize The State Auditor To Charge And Collect A Fee From The Participants In These Courses; And For Related Purposes.

2692.title: State Workforce Investment Board; authorize legislative members to receive per diem and expenses.
2692.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Legislative Members Of The Mississippi State Workforce Investment Board To Receive Per Diem And Expenses For Attending Meetings Of The Board; And For Related Purposes.

2693.title: Vehicle-charge providers; allow under certain conditions in any certificated electric service area.
2693.description: An Act To Create New Section 77-3-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow, Under Prescribed Conditions, The Provision Of Electricity To Vehicles In Certificated Electric Service Areas In The State Of Mississippi By Persons Other Than The Certificated Electric Public Utility For The Purpose Of Providing An Electrical Charge To The Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

2694.title: School district consolidation; require in certain counties and study administrative consolidation of agricultural high schools.
2694.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-7-104.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Bolivar County There Shall Be An Administrative Consolidation Into Two School Districts To Be Designated As North Bolivar Consolidated School District And West Bolivar Consolidated School District; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education To Develop And Promulgate A Consolidation Order For The School Districts In Said County Under Certain Standards; To Provide For Two New Boards Of Trustees To Be Elected In Such Consolidated School District In A November 2013 Special Election; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Administratively Consolidate Any School District Which Does Not Voluntarily Follow The Consolidation Order; To Abolish The Former School Boards Following The Administrative Consolidation And Provide For The Transfer Of School District Assets And Liabilities; To Provide For Execution Of Teacher And School District Employee Contracts In The New School Districts And To Provide For The Preparation Of School District Budgets In The New School Districts; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Promulgate Regulations To Implement Such Administrative Consolidation; To Amend Section 37-7-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 37-27-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Education To Develop A Report With Recommendations On The Administrative Consolidation Of The State's Agricultural High Schools; And For Related Purposes.

2695.title: School District Procurement Efficiency Commission; continue under State Department of Education and authorize procurement cards.
2695.description: An Act To Establish A Commission On School District Efficiency Within The State Department Of Education And Require Annual Reports To The Governor And The Legislature Relative To Business Efficiency Standards For Accreditation; To Amend Sections 37-7-301, 37-61-33 And 31-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Adopt Purchasing Regulations Regarding The Use Of Procurement Cards By School Districts And Teacher Supply Funds And To Issue Procurement Cards To Teachers On An Annual Basis For The Purchase Of Said Instructional Materials; To Amend Section 37-151-103 And 37-9-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Payroll Date For School Districts; To Amend Section 37-7-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Use Of Donated Leave By School District Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

2696.title: Educational technology infrastructure upgrades; provide certain funding sources for school districts.
2696.description: An Act Relating To Public Education Finance; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts To Issue State Aid Educational Technology Improvement Bonds And To Provide The Amount The School Districts May Pledge From Adequate Education Program Funds For Repayment Of The Bonds And Earmark These Proceeds For Educational Technology Infrastructure Upgrades, Electronic Textbooks And Technology Hardware; To Amend Section 37-59-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts To Issue Short-term Notes For Educational Technology Infrastructure Upgrades, Electronic Textbooks And Technology Hardware; To Amend Section 37-59-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Ad Valorem Tax Limitation On Short-term Notes; To Amend Section 37-43-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Textbook Fund May Be Utilized By School Districts For The Purchase Of Educational Technology Infrastructure Upgrades, Electronic Textbooks And Technology Hardware; To Amend Section 37-61-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Increased Sales Tax Collections From Internet Sales Shall Be Deposited Into The Education Enhancement Fund And Earmarked For Educational Technology Infrastructure Upgrades, Electronic Textbooks And Technology Hardware; To Amend Section 27-67-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Collection Of Taxes On Internet Sales; And For Related Purposes.

2697.title: Public water authorities; prohibit eminent domain of water or sewer facilities unless PSC cancels certificate for service area.
2697.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-41-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Legislative Intent Of The Chapter Of Law Creating Public Water Authorities; To Amend Section 51-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Certain Terms; To Create Section 51-41-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Municipality From Exercising Eminent Domain Over The Facilities Of A Qualified Corporation Or Water Authority, Unless The Public Service Commission Cancels The Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity For The Service Area Wherein The Facilities Are Located; And For Related Purposes.

2698.title: Community public water systems; require continuing management training for board members.
2698.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-26-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Continuing Management Training For Board Members Of Community Public Water Systems; And For Related Purposes.

2699.title: Public Service Commission; shall cancel water or sewer certificate before municipality exercises eminent domain.
2699.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Public Service Commission To Cancel A Water Or Sewer System's Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity Before A Municipality Or Other Entity Exercises Eminent Domain Over The System's Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2700.title: Early Voting Act; authorize voting prior to election day.
2700.description: An Act To Authorize A Qualified Elector To Vote Early Not More Than 21 Days Nor Less Than 5 Days Before The Date Of An Election; To Provide That Early Voting May Be Conducted In The Registrar's Office Or At A Location Designated By The Registrar; To Require A Person Who Desires To Vote Early To Appear At The Registrar's Office And To Provide That After Signing The Receipt Book Such Person Shall Be Entitled To Vote At The Registrar's Office Or At The Location Designated By The Registrar During The Early Voting Period In The Same Manner As He Would At His Voting Precinct On The Day Of The Election; To Provide That The Election Laws That Govern Procedures For A Person Who Appears To Vote On The Day Of Election Shall Apply When A Person Appears To Vote During The Early Voting Period; To Provide That All Votes Cast During The Early Voting Period Shall Be Final; To Provide That The Votes Cast During Early Voting Shall Be Announced Simultaneously With The Vote Cast On Election Day; To Provide That Each Candidate Shall Have The Right To Be Present At The Registrar's Office And To Challenge The Qualifications Of Any Person Offering To Vote Early In The Same Manner As Provided By Law At The Polling Place On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Effectuate Early Voting; To Amend Sections 23-15-195, 23-15-653 And 23-15-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 23-15-627, 23-15-637, 23-15-641, 23-15-713 And 23-15-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Voters May Not Cast Absentee Ballots At The Office Of The Registrar During The Early Voting Period; And For Related Purposes.

2701.title: Campaign finance reports; circuit and municipal clerks must forward copies of to Secretary of State within 10 days of receiving.
2701.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Circuit Clerks And Municipal Clerks Shall Forward Copies Of All Campaign Finance Reports To The Office Of The Secretary Of State Within Ten Calendar Days Of Receiving Such Reports; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Make All The Campaign Finance Reports Filed With Or Forwarded To His Office Available To The Public Online Through The Use Of The Internet; And For Related Purposes.

2703.title: Voter registration; authorize person to apply online.
2703.description: An Act To Authorize Persons Eligible To Vote In This State Who Possess A Current And Valid Mississippi Driver's License Or Identification Card To Submit Voter Registration Applications Through A Secure Internet Website Established By The Secretary Of State; To Allow Persons Who Are Registered To Vote To Update Their Voter Registration Information Using Such Website; To Provide That Such Applications Shall Be Forwarded Electronically To The Department Of Public Safety And The Department Shall Compare The Information Submitted By The Applicant With The Information Maintained In The Department's Database Listing Individuals Who Possess A Current And Valid Mississippi Driver's License Or Identification Card And, If The Department Of Public Safety Determines That The Applicant Is Eligible To Submit An Online Application, The Department Shall Electronically Forward The Application And Certain Other Information To The Secretary Of State; To Provide That The Secretary Of State Shall Forward The Application And Additional Information Received From The Department Of Public Safety To The Registrar Of The County In Which The Applicant Currently Resides; To Provide Procedures By Which The County Registrar Shall Process Such Applications; To Amend Section 23-15-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2705.title: Karen's Law; revise punishment for manslaughter of certain child victims.
2705.description: An Act To Be Known As "karen's Law"; To Amend Section 97-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Imprisonment For Persons Who Were Over The Age Of 21 When Convicted Of The Homicide Of A Child Of A Certain Age; And For Related Purposes.

2706.title: Election law task force; create.
2706.description: An Act To Create And Empower A Special Task Force To Study The Status Of Mississippi's Election Process To Consider All Matters Relating To Elections In Mississippi And Make Recommendations Thereon; And For Related Purposes.

2707.title: Campaign finance reports; circuit and municipal clerks must forward reports filed with them to the Secretary of State within 10 days.
2707.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Circuit Clerks And Municipal Clerks To Forward Reports Of Campaign Contributions Or Expenditures Filed With Them To The Secretary Of State Within 10 Days After The Reports Are Filed; And For Related Purposes.

2708.title: Voter identification; require those who appear to vote to present proper.
2708.description: An Act To Require A Qualified Elector Who Appears To Vote At The Registrar's Office Or A Polling Place To Present Identification Before Voting; To Require The Secretary Of State To Negotiate A Memorandum Of Understanding Between The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety And The Registrar Of Each County For The Purpose Of Providing A Mississippi Voter Identification Card; To Amend Sections 23-15-11, 23-15-541, 23-15-631, 23-15-639 And 23-15-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; And For Related Purposes.

2709.title: Statewide Elections Management System; require the registrar to utilize in processing absentee ballot applications.
2709.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-625, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Absentee Ballot Applications To Be Processed By The Registrar Utilizing The Statewide Elections Management System; To Provide That All Absentee Ballots Transmitted To Or Received From A Voter Shall Be Processed And Accounted For By The Registrar Utilizing The Statewide Elections Management System; To Require The Registrar To Utilize The Statewide Elections Management System To Keep An Accurate List Of All Persons Preparing Such Ballots; And For Related Purposes.

2710.title: School and district accreditation rating terminology; direct State Dept. of Education to change to "A," "B," "C," "D" and "F".
2710.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Education And The State Department Of Education To Change The Performance Level Terminology For Schools And School Districts To "a", "b", "c", "d" And "f" Based On Established Benchmarks Of Student Achievement And Growth; To Provide That Such New Terminology For Accreditation Rating Purposes Shall Be Effective Upon Full Implementation Of Common Core State Standards And Assessments; And For Related Purposes.

2711.title: Blind Person's Literacy Rights and Education Act; revise to confirm to federal law.
2711.description: An Act To Revise Certain Provisions Of The Blind Persons' Literacy Rights And Education Act; To Amend Section 37-23-193, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Of Certain Terms And To Define Additional Terms Used In The Act; To Amend Section 37-23-194, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Blind And Visually Impaired Students Should Receive Educational Services From Certified Teachers Of The Visually Impaired; To Amend Section 37-23-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Appropriate Educational Entity To Provide For Instruction In Braille And The Use Of Braille Unless The Iep Committee Determines, After An Evaluation Of The Child's Needs, If Instruction In Braille Or The Use Of Braille Is Not Appropriate For The Child; To Require Assessments For Students To Include A Minimum Research-based Learning Media Assessment; To Prohibit The Denial Of Instruction In Braille To Students With Some Residual Vision; To Amend Section 37-23-197, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Standard Procedure To Be Used By The Iep Or 504 Team That Braille Instruction Or The Use Of Braille Is Required For Blind Students; To Require The Iep Or 504 Team To Base Its Decision On The Current Ability And Needs And Future Needs Of Students, While Considering The Appropriate Reading And Writing Media For Children With Some Residual Vision; To Amend Section 37-23-199, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Textbook Publishers That Sell Books To Mississippi School Districts To Furnish American Standard Code For Information Interchange (ascii) Or Other Electronically Formatted Files Compatible With Braille Conversion For All Books And Supplementary Materials For Literary And Nonliterary Subjects; To Require The State Board Of Education To Promulgate And Publish Regulations, Policies And Procedures For The Administrative Operation Of The Mississippi Instructional Resource Center; To Amend Section 37-23-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Certification Qualifications For Specialists In Braille Who Serve On The Advisory Committee; To Establish The Time Within Which The State Superintendent Of Public Education Has To Respond To The Recommendations Of The Advisory Committee; To Amend Section 37-23-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Recognize Braille And Orientation Mobility As Core Subject Areas For All Blind Students; To Require The Department To Adopt A Minimum Standard For Teachers Of The Blind Certified After January 1, 2010; To Establish The Method For Determining Competency In Reading And Writing Of Literary Braille And Nemeth Code; And For Related Purposes.

2712.title: Public Service Commission; revise jurisdiction to exclude certain technological services.
2712.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Terms "video Services," "voice Over Internet Protocol Services," "commercial Mobile Services" And "internet Protocol Enabled Services," And To Provide That Such Services Shall Not Be Included In The Regulation Of Public Utilities; To Amend Section 77-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Service Commission Shall Have Jurisdiction Over Intrastate Switched Access Service Provided By Public Utilities; To Provide That The Rate Structure Used For The Provision Of Intrastate Switched Access Service Shall Be The Same As Those Used For The Provision Of Interstate Switched Access Service; And For Related Purposes.

2713.title: Public Service Commission and Public Utilities Staff; authorize to hire attorneys or consultants in proceedings before FERC.
2713.description: An Act To Authorize The Public Service Commission And The Public Utilities Staff To Hire Attorneys Or Consultants In Proceedings Before The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, Other Federal Agencies And Federal Courts; And For Related Purposes.

2714.title: Motor Carriers; conform code sections to reflect prior transfer of duties of the PSC to the Mississippi Transportation Commission.
2714.description: An Act To Amend Motor Carriers Laws To Reflect The Prior Transfer Of The Duties Of The Public Service Commission To The Mississippi Transportation Commission; To Amend Sections 77-7-7, 77-7-21, 77-7-23, 77-7-55, 77-7-115, 77-7-119, 77-7-125, 77-7-127, 77-7-333, 77-7-335, 77-7-337 And 77-7-339, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Sections 77-9-5, 77-9-119, 77-9-489 And 77-9-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Prior Transfer Of The Duties Of The Public Service Commission Related To Railroads To The Mississippi Transportation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

2715.title: MS Wireless Communication Commission; remove authority regarding local government entities.
2715.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The Mississippi Wireless Communication Commission To Approve All Wireless Communications Systems Owned Or Operated By Any Local Government Entity; And For Related Purposes.

2716.title: Petroleum products; require at least one pump with no ethanol additive.
2716.description: An Act To Require That Any Person Engaged In The Distribution Of Liquefied Petroleum Gas As At Retail To Provide At Least One Pump With No Ethanol Added To The Liquefied Petroleum Gas; And For Related Purposes.

2717.title: Public utilities; charitable or civic contributions shall not be allowed as costs or expenses for rate-making purposes.
2717.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Or Civic Contributions Made By Public Utilities Shall Not Be Allowed In Any Amount As Costs Or Expenses For Rate-making Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2718.title: Public Service Commission; shall have jurisdiction over rates for electricity provided by TVA directly to industrial customers.
2718.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Service Commission Shall Not Have Jurisdiction To Regulate The Rates For Wholesale Electric Services By The Tennessee Valley Authority To Cooperative Electric Power Associations, Except For Services Provided By The Tennessee Valley Authority Directly To Industrial Customers In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2719.title: Department of Finance and Administration; required to convey certain property to MS Transportation Commission.
2719.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Convey The Mississippi Transportation Commission Certain Real Property Along North West Street Within The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2720.title: Public land at Mississippi State Penitentiary; authorize Secretary of State to lease for wind power generation projects.
2720.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-5-64 And 47-5-66, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Lease Public Land Located At The Mississippi State Penitentiary; To Provide That Lease Payments For Such Projects Shall Be Deposited Into The Prison Agricultural Enterprise Fund With 15% Earmarked For The Public Schools Of Sunflower County; And For Related Purposes.

2721.title: Old National Guard Armory; authorize DFA to demolish.
2721.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Demolish The Old National Guard Armory Located On High Street In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2722.title: Hob Bryan Lawn; name the green space between Carroll Gartin Justice Building and Sillers Building in honor of Senator Bryan.
2722.description: An Act To Provide That The Green Space Located Between The Carroll Gartin Justice Building And The Walter Sillers Office Building Complex Shall Be Named The "hob Bryan Lawn"; And For Related Purposes.

2723.title: Marshall County property; Mississippi Transportation Commission may donate certain real property to Marshall County.
2723.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Donate To Marshall County A Certain 29.11-acre Parcel Of Real Property Located In Marshall County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2724.title: New Capitol Building; Archives and History employ a Curator of the Capitol to oversee, approve and monitor care of.
2724.description: An Act To Create New Section 39-5-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of The Department Of Archives And History Shall Employ A Curator Of The New Capitol Building; To Provide That The Duties Of The Curator Are To Oversee, Initiate, Approve And Monitor The Care Of The New Capitol Building And Grounds, To Ensure Long-term Preservation, Conservation And Maintenance Of The Building, Historic Furnishings And Grounds, And To Coordinate With Personnel Of The Department Of Finance And Administration And The Project Professionals On Any Repair, Renovation Or Restoration Plans For The New Capitol Building Or Grounds; And For Related Purposes.

2725.title: Mississippi UPSTART school readiness project; create.
2725.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Upstart Project To Serve As A Home-based Educational Technology Program To Develop School Readiness Skills Of Preschool Children; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Contract With A Not-for-profit Organization For Purposes Of Providing Delivery Of The Program For Preschool Children; To Prescribe The Responsibilities And Duties Of The Provider For The Administration Of The Program; To Require That The Contract Provide For One Year Of Funding For The Program With An Option To Extend The Contract For Additional Years Or Expand The Program To A Greater Number Of Preschool Children; To Authorize A Local School To Participate In Mississippi Upstart If The Local School Board Agrees To Work In Cooperation With The Contractor; To Authorize Family Participation In The Program And To Prescribe The Manner Of Soliciting Family Participation; To Authorize The State Board Of Education Or Participating Local School District To Purchase Certain Equipment And Services To Be Used In The Program; To Require An Annual Audit Of The Use Of Funds Used For Mississippi Upstart; To Require That The Audit Requirement Be Included In The Contract; To Require The State Board Of Education To Make An Annual Legislative Report By November 30 Each Year; To Provide That No State General Funds May Be Used To Carry Out The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2726.title: Dual enrollment-dual credit work skills certificate program in high school and community college; establish pilot program.
2726.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Students To Dually Enroll In Their Home High School And A Local Community College In A Dual Credit Program Consisting Of High School Completion Courses And A Work Skills Certificate Program; To Establish This Dual Credit Option On A Pilot Program Basis To Be Implemented Statewide In The 2013-2014 School Year; To Prescribe The Components Of The Dual Credit Option Program; To Amend Sections 37-151-5 And 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide State Funding Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program For The Dual Credit Program; To Require The County Tax Assessors To Annually Submit To The State Department Of Education Certain Information Relating To The Assessed Value Of Property Which Is Used By The Department In Determining The Amount That Each School District Must Contribute Toward The Cost Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Require The State Department Of Education To Make A Form Available To The Tax Assessors For The Submission Of The Reports; And For Related Purposes.

2727.title: Sixteenth section school land; authorize long-term contracts for sale of wood fiber.
2727.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Local Boards Of Education Which Approve Of Sales Of Timber And Forest Products Growing On 16th Section Lands To Enter Into Long-term Public And Private Contracts For The Sale Of Wood Fiber; And For Related Purposes.

2728.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program; increase funding for at-risk pupils.
2728.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Allotment Of Mississippi Adequate Education Program Funding For At-risk Students; And For Related Purposes.

2729.title: Department of Revenue; authorize Department of Finance and Administration to purchase property for DOR's headquarters.
2729.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Department Of Revenue, To Purchase Certain Real Property Also Known As The "landmark Center" Located At 175 East Capitol Street In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, To Function As The Department Of Revenue's New Headquarters; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, To Remove The Authority To Issue State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 For Equipping Of A New Headquarters Building For The Department Of Revenue To Be Located In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, At A Site Selected By The Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

2730.title: Public-university property; IHL Board to approve the purchase and sale of real property by MUW, USM, DSU, JSU and MVSU.
2730.description: An Act To Create New Sections To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Acquire And Sell Any Real Property On Behalf Of Mississippi University For Women, The University Of Southern Mississippi, Delta State University, Jackson State University And Mississippi Valley State University; To Amend Sections 37-117-1, 37-119-1, 37-123-1, 37-125-1 And 37-127-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2731.title: Open Meetings Act; include rural water systems or associations.
2731.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "public Body" Under The Open Meetings Act To Include Rural Water Associations, Rural Water Systems Or Certain Nonprofit, Nonshare Corporations Under The Open Meetings Act; To Amend Section 79-11-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Rights Of Members Of Member-owned Rural Water Associations Or Systems; To Provide That Such Members Shall Receive Certain Notice For Election Of Board Members; And For Related Purposes.

2732.title: Minors; community service imposed for tobacco possession.
2732.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-32-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Permit Imposition Of Community Service For A Minor Who Violates The Youth Access To Tobacco Act If The Minor Is Concurrently In Violation Of Any Other Law; And For Related Purposes.

2733.title: Threat of bodily harm; felony under certain circumstances.
2733.description: An Act To Create The Offense Of Threatening Bodily Harm By A Person Previously Convicted Of Certain Felonies; To Prescribe Penalties For A Violation; And For Related Purposes.

2734.title: Minors; limit ticket forgiveness for driver education.
2734.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Traffic Violators Who Are Minors May Only Take One Driver Education And Training Program Or Traffic Safety Violator Course Per Year For The Purpose Of Avoiding Certain Misdemeanor Convictions; To Amend Section 63-9-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2735.title: Helmets; revise safety standard for minors on ATVs.
2735.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-7-64 And 63-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct The Reference To The Entity Authorized To Approve Motorcycle Crash Helmet Standards For Drivers Of Motorcycles And All-terrain Vehicles; To Amend Section 63-3-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

2736.title: Uniform traffic ticket law; revise to allow electronic filing for DUI tickets.
2736.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Electronic Filing For Citations Issued For Violations Of The Mississippi Implied Consent Law; And For Related Purposes.

2737.title: Lonnie Smith Act; revise elements of the offense of felonious child abuse.
2737.description: An Act To Be Known As The Lonnie Smith Act; To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Elements Of The Offense Of Felonious Child Abuse; And For Related Purposes.

2740.title: Landowner Protection Act; create.
2740.description: An Act To Create The Landowner Protection Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide That A Possessor Of Land Does Not Owe A Duty Of Care To A Trespasser And Is Not Liable For Injury To A Trespasser; To Provide Exceptions; To Provide For The Application Of The Provisions Of This Act To Commercial Or Other Real Property Owners; To Provide Severability; And For Related Purposes.

2741.title: Abandoned personal property; landlord may dispose of property left by tenant in the rented premises after a seven-day waiting period.
2741.description: An Act To Amend Sections 89-7-31, 89-7-41 And 89-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That After A Seven-day Waiting Period, A Landlord May Dispose Of Personal Property Abandoned By An Evicted Tenant In A Dwelling Unit; And For Related Purposes.

2742.title: Abandoned personal property; landlord may dispose of property left by tenant in the rented premises.
2742.description: An Act To Amend Sections 89-7-31, 89-7-41 And 89-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Landlord May Dispose Of Personal Property Abandoned By An Evicted Tenant In A Dwelling Unit; And For Related Purposes.

2743.title: Environmental fees; authorize Commission on Environmental Quality to set to cover costs of permitting programs.
2743.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Create The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Amend Sections 51-3-31, 51-5-1, 53-7-21, 53-7-25, 53-7-69 And 49-31-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission To Set Program Fees And To Direct Fees To The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Bring Forward Section 53-7-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Applications For The Modification, Transfer Or Reissuance Of Any Surface Mining Permit, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2744.title: Products liability; revise.
2744.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-1-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Designers In The Provisions Regarding Conditions For Liability For Products Liability; And For Related Purposes.

2746.title: Environmental Quality; remove the cap on maximum fee for air operating permit under Title V.
2746.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-17-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Maximum Annual Fee Limitation For Air Operating Permits Required Under Title V Of The Federal Clean Air Act; And For Related Purposes.

2747.title: Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Reservoir Patrol; authorize to participate in multijurisdictional operations.
2747.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-9-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Pearl River Valley Water District Reservoir Patrol To Participate In Multijurisdictional Training, Law Enforcement And Emergency Operations; And For Related Purposes.

2748.title: Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Reservoir Police; authorize to participate in multijurisdictional operations.
2748.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-9-176, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Pearl River Valley Water District Reservoir Police To Participate In Multijurisdictional Training, Law Enforcement And Emergency Operations; To Change The Name Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Reservoir Patrol To Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Reservoir Police; To Amend Sections 51-9-171, 51-9-175, 51-9-177, 51-9-179, 51-9-181 And 51-9-183, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2749.title: Litter; prohibit littering on certain property of the Pearl River Water Supply District.
2749.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-27-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Littering On Certain Property Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District; To Provide Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2750.title: Transportation; transfer law enforcement duties of MDOT to the Department of Public Safety.
2750.description: An Act To Transfer Law Enforcement Personnel And Law Enforcement Duties Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Related To The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law To The Motor Carrier Division Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Within The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety; To Amend Sections 77-7-16 And 45-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 77-1-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provided For The Employment Of Personnel By The Public Service Commission To Enforce The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law; To Repeal Section 77-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provided For The Transfer Of Law Enforcement Personnel Of Motor Carrier Regulatory Law To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation From The Public Service Commission; To Repeal Section 77-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Public Service Commission To Provide For The Payment Of Employees Enforcing The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law; And For Related Purposes.

2751.title: Environmental justice; require meaningful involvement of all people in siting process.
2751.description: An Act To Require The Fair Treatment And Meaningful Involvement Of All People Regardless Of Race, Color, National Origin Or Income With Regard To The Development And Enforcement Of Environmental Laws And The Siting Of Certain Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2752.title: Reservoir patrol; expand police power to offenses committed in the presence of.
2752.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-9-175, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant The Reservoir Patrol The Power To Make Arrests For Crimes Committed In Their Presence; And For Related Purposes.

2753.title: Compulsory automobile insurance; violators may be towed.
2753.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Towing Of A Vehicle If The Operator Is In Violation Of The Motor Vehicle Safety-responsibility Law; And For Related Purposes.

2754.title: State Highway System; require certain section of MS Highway 9 in Pontotoc County to remain in the system.
2754.description: An Act To Provide That Mississippi Highway 9 In Pontotoc County Shall Remain In The State Highway System; To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Maintain That Section Of Mississippi Highway 9; And For Related Purposes.

2755.title: Memorial Highway; designate Mississippi Highway 8 in Ruleville, Mississippi, as the Robert L."Bob" Crook Memorial Highway.
2755.description: An Act To Designate And Name A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 8 In Ruleville, Mississippi, As The Robert L."bob" Crook Memorial Highway; And For Related Purposes.

2756.title: Transportation; Direct MDOT to straighten curve on MS Highway 397 in Kemper County.
2756.description: An Act To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Straighten A Curve On Mississippi 397 In Kemper County; And For Related Purposes.

2758.title: MS Railroad Improvements Fund; authorize MS Transportation to administer the fund & declare the necessity for the issuance of bonds for.
2758.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-46-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Administer The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund; To Amend Section 45, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Declare By Resolution The Necessity For Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2759.title: Memorial highway; designate certain segment of MS Hwy. 15 North in Jasper County as Richard Alexandra "Dickie" Ware Memorial Highway.
2759.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 15 North In Jasper County As Richard Alexandra "dickie" Ware Memorial Highway; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Highway 61 South In Adams County As The "sfc Severin West Summers Iii Memorial Highway"; To Designate That Segment Of Mississippi Highway 6 Within Lafayette County, Mississippi, As The "military Order Of The Purple Heart Highway"; To Designate And Name A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 8 In Sunflower County As The Robert L."bob" Crook Memorial Highway; To Designate U.s. Highway 82 As The "mississippi Heritage Highway"; To Authorize Municipalities And Counties To Designate Historical Sites And Events Along The Highway; To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Department To Approve And Erect Heritage Highway Markers; And For Related Purposes.

2760.title: Highways; remove requirement of an alternate untolled route before construction of a toll road.
2760.description: An Act To Amend Sections 65-43-1 And 65-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Must Be An Alternate Untolled Route For Toll Roads; And For Related Purposes.

2761.title: Memorial highways; designate certain segment of U.S. Highway 11 in Lamar County as "Tyler Kilsby and Leon Sims Memorial Highway."
2761.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Portion Of U.s. Highway 11 In Lamar County As The "tyler Kilsby And Leon Sims Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2762.title: Offshore drilling operations; prohibit on state-owned land in Block 71.
2762.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Offshore Drilling Operations On State-owned Land In Block 71, North Of The Coastal Barrier Islands; And For Related Purposes.

2763.title: Multi-modal transportation; include regional railroad authorities in Multi-Modal Transportation Improvement Fund.
2763.description: An Act To Amend Section 65-1-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Amend The Definition Of Railroad To Include Regional Railroad Authorities For The Purpose Of Including The Authorities In The Multi-modal Transportation Improvement Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2764.title: Municipal airport authorities; establish procedure to enforce aircraft liens.
2764.description: An Act To Establish A Procedure For Airport Authorities And Municipalities To Enforce Aircraft Liens; And For Related Purposes.

2765.title: Domestic violence; revise adjudication, punishment and registration of protection orders.
2765.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-21-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Venue Of A Domestic Abuse Petition; To Amend Section 93-21-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify And Revise Jurisdiction Of Domestic Abuse Petitions; To Amend Section 93-21-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify And Revise The Use Of Standardized Forms For Emergency Domestic Abuse Protection Orders And The Entry Of Such Orders Into The Protection Order Registry; To Amend Section 93-21-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify And Revise The Use Of Standardized Forms For Domestic Abuse Protection Orders And To Revise Entry Of Orders In The Protection Order Registry; To Amend Section 93-21-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify And Revise The Imposition Of Sanctions, Whether Civil Or Criminal, For A Knowing Violation Of A Protection Order; To Amend Sections 93-21-25 And 93-22-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duty Of Entering Information Into The Protection Order Registry And The Effect Of Registering Or Not Registering Foreign Orders; To Amend Sections 97-3-7 And 99-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Relationships Triggering Domestic Violence Designation For Simple And Aggravated Assault; To Amend Section 99-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify What Acts Of Domestic Violence Require Personal Appearance Before A Judge Before Bail Is Set And To Require That Bond Conditions Imposed Are Entered Into The Corresponding Offense Report; To Amend Section 93-21-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Pretrial Diversion And Nonadjudication Status For Certain Domestic Violence Offenders And To Authorize The Attorney General To Form An Advisory Group To Propose Regulations For Domestic Abuse Intervention Programs That Are Used As A Sentencing Option; To Amend Section 99-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Judges To Check The Attorney General's Protective Order Registry Before Granting Bail On Certain Other Charges; To Amend Section 99-15-26, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Pretrial Diversion For Counseling Option In Certain Domestic Abuse Prosecutions; And For Related Purposes.

2766.title: Cock fighting; revise penalty.
2766.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For Cock Fighting; To Amend Section 97-41-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2768.title: Expunction of record; allow filing fee in municipal court.
2768.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Filing Fee To Be Charged In Municipal Court For A Petition For Expunction; To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct An Error In The Cross-reference To Section 99-19-71 Concerning The Fee To Be Charged By The Circuit Clerk For Expunction Of Records; And For Related Purposes.

2769.title: Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; repeal.
2769.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-13-1 Through 63-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Additional Tag Fee And To Provide For The Distribution Of The Fee; To Amend Section 37-41-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2770.title: Drug rehabilitation program; require for persons convicted of drug crimes and for probationers who fail drug test.
2770.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-150, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Person Convicted Of Any Drug-related Offense To Complete At Least 30 Days Of A Drug Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Section 47-5-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Parolee Or Probationer Whose Chemical Analysis Test Shows The Unauthorized Presence Of A Controlled Substance To Complete At Least 30 Days Of A Drug Rehabilitation Program; And For Related Purposes.

2773.title: Motor vehicle inspection stickers; eliminate.
2773.description: An Act To Amend The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; To Amend Section 63-13-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Rename The Law As The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Law; To Amend Section 63-13-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections To Conform To The Tenor Of The Act; To Amend Section 63-13-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Designate The Motor Vehicle Inspection Department And To Promulgate Rules And Regulations; To Amend Section 63-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain Vehicles That Are Subject To Inspection By Other Entities From Safety Inspections Under This Chapter; To Amend Section 63-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reference Window Tint Inspections And Inspections Of Vehicles Equipped With A Liquefied Petroleum Or Natural Gas Carburetion System; To Amend Sections 63-13-15, 63-13-21 And 63-13-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Dealing With Window Tint, To Conform; To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Tag Fee; To Amend Section 37-41-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 63-13-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Grace Period For Obtaining A Valid Inspection Sticker; To Repeal Section 63-13-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Licensing Of Official Inspection Stations; To Repeal Section 63-13-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Improper Representation As An Inspection Station; To Repeal Section 63-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Inspections By Dealers; And For Related Purposes.

2774.title: Certified Investigator Program; create special fund to support homicide investigation training and impose surcharge on violations.
2774.description: An Act To Create New Section 45-6-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Certified Investigator Program Special Fund; To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Statewide Monetary Assessments To Provide Support For The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2775.title: Crime lab analysis; burden on defendant to require appearance at trial.
2775.description: An Act To Create A Procedure For Notice Of Appearance For Crime Lab Personnel In Certain Misdemeanor Prosecutions; And For Related Purposes.

2776.title: Statewide Monetary Assessments; revise assessment for Statewide Victims' Information and Notification System (SAVIN) Fund.
2776.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Statewide Monetary Assessment Assessed To Benefit The Statewide Victims' Information And Notification (savin) System Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2777.title: Bond; authorize posting by defendant as a condition of parole or early release.
2777.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Posting Of Bond As A Condition Of Parole Or Early Release To Secure The Appearance Of A Defendant For A Subsequent Parole Or Court Proceeding; To Amend Section 47-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2778.title: Cooperatives; provide for the incorporation of.
2778.description: An Act To Provide For The Incorporation Of Cooperative Associations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Requisites For The Articles Of Association Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Adoptions Of Bylaws By Cooperatives; To Specify The Membership Of Cooperatives And The Requisites For Voting By Members; To Provide For The Organization Of Meetings And The Notification Of Members Of Meetings; To Provide For The Authorization Of, Control And Use Of Stock By Cooperatives; To Provide For The Number, Election And Removal Of Directors; To Provide For The Meetings Of Directors; To Authorize Executive Committees; To Provide For The Officers Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Compensation And Benefits To Directors, Officers And Employees Of A Cooperative; To Provide For The Liability Of Directors, Members, Stockholders And Patrons Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Dispose Of Assets; To Provide Rules That Govern Contracts By Cooperatives; To Provide That The Directors Shall Determine And Distribute Net Assets At Least Once Annually; To Provide For Annual Reports; To Provide The Manner In Which Articles Of Association May Be Amended; To Provide The Manner In Which Cooperatives May Merge And Consolidate; To Provide The Manner In Which A Corporation May Convert Itself Into A Cooperative; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Voluntarily Dissolve Itself; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Be Involuntarily Dissolved; To Provide For The Liquidation Of The Assets And Business Of A Cooperative Under Court Supervision; To Provide For Derivative Actions By Members And Stockholders; To Limit The Use Of The Term "cooperative" To Associations Organized Under This Act And To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Such Term; And For Related Purposes.

2779.title: Tort Claims Act; clarify statute of limitations.
2779.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Both The Statute Of Limitations Under The Tort Claims Act And The Notices That Are Required To Be Provided As To A Claim Under That Act; And For Related Purposes.

2780.title: Certified Investigator Program; impose surcharge and create fund.
2780.description: An Act To Create The Certified Investigator Program Fund In Support Of The Certified Investigator Program Of The Minimum Standards Board; To Impose A Surcharge On Certain Violations; To Provide For Deposit Of The Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2781.title: Bail; restrict for certain crimes.
2781.description: An Act To Create Restrictions On The Granting Of Bail For Persons Charged With Certain Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

2783.title: Public records; fees charged for are restricted to actual costs.
2783.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Fees Which May Be Charged By Public Bodies To Provide Public Records; To Amend Section 25-61-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Civil Penalty For The Charging Of An Unreasonable Fee For Providing A Public Record; And For Related Purposes.

2785.title: Marriage license; eliminate 3-day waiting period and blood test.
2785.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The 3-day Waiting Period For A Marriage License And To Delete The Requirement For A Blood Test For Syphilis; To Repeal Section 93-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Right To Contest The Issuance Of A Marriage License By Any Interested Party; And For Related Purposes.

2787.title: Paternity proceeding; court may determine custody.
2787.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction Of The Court Over The Award Of Custody In The Course Of A Paternity Proceeding; And For Related Purposes.

2788.title: Advance health-care directives; MDOC may offer such forms to inmates and may act as guardian for certain inmates.
2788.description: An Act To Authorize The Commissioner Of The Department Of Corrections To Obtain Judicial Approval To Make Health-care Decisions For An Offender Who Lacks The Capacity To Make Such Decisions And Who Does Not Have A Relative Available To Make Such Decisions; To Authorize The Department To Provide An Offender With The Forms Necessary To Execute An Advance Health-care Directive; To Amend Section 93-13-135, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Chancery Court Of The County Of Residence Of An Offender To Appoint A Guardian To Make Health-care Decisions For The Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2789.title: Legal signature; conform to Mississippi Uniform Electronic Transactions Act.
2789.description: An Act To Amend Section 1-3-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Definition Of "written" To The Mississippi Uniform Electronic Transactions Act; And For Related Purposes.

2790.title: Visitation; enact limitations on parent with history of violent behavior.
2790.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Judicial Consideration Of Limitations On Supervised Visitation With A Noncustodial Parent Who Has A History Of Violent Behavior; And For Related Purposes.

2791.title: Court reporting; prohibit certain contracts as violative of the integrity of the judicial system.
2791.description: An Act To Create New Section 9-13-122, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Apply To Any Court Reporter Or Court Reporting Firm, Corporation, Or Other Entity; To Prohibit The Taking Of Depositions By Court Reporters Who Have Conflicts Of Interest; To Specify The Prohibited Conflicts Of Interest; To Ensure Comparable Treatment Of All Parties; To Prohibit Any Waiver Of This Act; To Exempt Governmental Entities Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2793.title: Estates; enact notice and representation rules.
2793.description: An Act To Provide For Notice And Representation Rules Regarding Administrative Or Judicial Proceedings Involving Estates Of Decedents Or Trusts; And For Related Purposes.

2794.title: Implied Consent Law; revise penalty when death results from aggravated DUI.
2794.description: An Act To Enact "james' Law"; To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Sentence For A Death Caused By A Violation Of Operating A Motor Vehicle Under The Influence Of Intoxicating Liquor, Drugs Or Controlled Substances; And For Related Purposes.

2795.title: RICO Act; amend to incorporate federal predicate act offenses and to authorize civil relief without a criminal conviction.
2795.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Incorporate The Predicate Act Offenses Prohibited Under The Federal Racketeer Influenced And Corrupt Organization Act; To Amend Section 97-43-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement Of A Criminal Conviction Before A Person May Institute Civil Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

2796.title: Long-arm statute; revise completion of service of process.
2796.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-3-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Service Of Process That Is Mailed Under The Automobile Collision Long-arm Statute Shall Be Complete Upon Filing Of Evidence That The Mail Was Not Able To Be Delivered Due To Actions Taken Or Not Taken By The Defendant; And For Related Purposes.

2797.title: Banks; self-assessment reports are privileged and not admissible in civil or administrative proceedings.
2797.description: An Act To Provide That Self-assessment Reports Of Depository Financial Institutions Are Privileged And Not Admissible In Any Legal Or Investigative Action In Any Civil Or Administrative Proceeding, And Are Not Subject To Any Discovery Pursuant To The Rules Of Civil Procedure Or Administrative Procedure; To Provide Exceptions To The Self-assessment Privilege; To Provide That All Reports That Are Protected By The Self-assessment Privilege Shall Be Exempt From The Public Records Act; And For Related Purposes.

2798.title: Conveyance installation and maintenance; establish licensure and minimum standards.
2798.description: An Act Establishing Minimum Standards For Conveyance Personnel And Services; To Provide For The Scope Of The Act; To Define Certain Terms Used In The Act; To Provide For The Licensure Of Elevator Contractors, Elevator Mechanics And Elevator Inspectors, And To Establish Qualifications Therefor; To Provide For Biennial Renewal Of Licenses; To Provide That Licenses May Be Suspended, Revoked Or Subject To Civil Penalties Upon Certain Violations; To Require Registration Of Existing Elevators, Platform Lifts, Dumbwaiters, Escalators, Moving Walks And Any Other Conveyance; To Require Installations And/or Service And Maintenance To Be Performed In Compliance With The State Fire Prevention And Building Code; To Require Permits Before A Conveyance Is Erected, Constructed, Installed Or Altered Within Buildings Or Structures; To Provide Civil Penalties For Violations Of The Act; To Provide That The Provisions Of The Act Are Not Retroactive Unless Otherwise Stated; To Provide That The Owner Of All New And Existing Conveyances Located In Any Building Or Structure Shall Have The Responsibility Of Having The Conveyance Inspected Annually By A Licensed Elevator Inspector; To Exempt From The Provisions Of This Act Any Elevator In A Private Residence; To Bring Forward For Purposes Of Amendment Sections 31-3-1, 31-3-3, 31-3-5, 31-3-13 And 31-3-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Define The Duties And Responsibilities Of The Board Of Contractors; And For Related Purposes.

2800.title: Animal cruelty; revise seizure of maltreated, neglected or abandoned animals.
2800.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Seizure Of Maltreated, Neglected Or Abandoned Animals Under The Animal Cruelty Law; And For Related Purposes.

2801.title: Scrap metal dealers; clarify sale of stolen manhole covers.
2801.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Metal Property For Purposes Of The Copper-theft Law And To Clarify That It Is Illegal To Sell Metal Property Stolen From A Municipality, Utility Or Other Governmental Entity; And For Related Purposes.

2804.title: MS Gulf Coast Region Utility Act; revise powers and duties of the county utility authorities.
2804.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-17-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To State Legislative Intent And Findings; To Amend Section 49-17-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms; To Amend Section 49-17-715, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Powers And Duties Of The George County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-719, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Powers And Duties Of The Pearl River County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-723, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Powers And Duties Of The Stone County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-727, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Powers And Duties Of The Harrison County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-731, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Powers And Duties Of The Jackson County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-735, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Powers And Duties Of The Hancock County Utility Authority And To Limit Its Service Area To Its Certificate Of Public Convenience And Necessity; To Amend Section 49-17-743, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The General Powers And Duties Of The County Utility Authorities And The Power Of Eminent Domain; To Amend Section 49-17-745, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A County Utility Authority May Operate Systems Within Its Service Area; To Amend Section 49-17-751, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certificates Of Public Convenience And Necessity Of Other Utilities May Be Transferred To A County Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2805.title: Federal Workforce Investment Act; Hinds County is separate workforce investment area.
2805.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-153-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Hinds County Shall Be A Separate Workforce Investment Area Under The Federal Workforce Investment Act; And For Related Purposes.
