2806.title: Post-release supervision; violent offenders required to serve period of post-release supervision on house arrest.
2806.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Offenders Convicted Of Violent Crimes To Serve Post-relief Supervision On House Arrest; And For Related Purposes.

2807.title: Smoking in all public places; prohibit.
2807.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Uniform Smoke-free Public Place Act Of 2012"; To Prohibit Smoking In Public Places; To Provide For Definitions; To Prohibit Smoking In Certain Public Places And Areas; To Prohibit Smoking In Any Indoor Or Outdoor Public Facility In Mississippi During Any Time That Persons Under 18 Years Of Age Are Engaged In An Organized Athletic Event In The Facility; To Provide For Exceptions; To Provide For Posting Of Signs And Removal Of Ashtrays; To Provide For An Informational Program; To Provide For Enforcement By The State Department Of Health; To Provide That Violations Of Smoking Prohibition Are Punishable By Civil Penalty; To Provide That This Prohibition Supercedes Local Ordinances; To Amend Sections 29-5-160, 29-5-161 And 29-5-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Enforcement And Penalty Provisions Of This Act Shall Be Applicable To The Statutes Prohibiting Smoking In Government Buildings, To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In Government Buildings Are Applicable To Government-owned Vehicles And To Provide That Prohibitions On Smoking In University Or College Buildings Are Applicable To Private Universities And Colleges; To Amend Section 97-32-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Smoking In All Private School Buildings And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2810.title: Bonds; State Treasurer shall prepare a statement regarding the fiscal effect of bond legislation introduced in the Legislature.
2810.description: An Act To Provide That For Any Legislation Introduced In The Legislature Authorizing The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds, The State Treasurer Shall Prepare A Statement Containing Certain Information Regarding Fiscal Effect If All The Bonds Authorized Are Issued; To Require A Copy Of The Statement To Be Filed With Both Houses Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2811.title: Blind Person's Literacy Rights and Education Act; revise to conform to federal law.
2811.description: An Act To Revise Certain Provisions Of The Blind Persons' Literacy Rights And Education Act; To Amend Section 37-23-193, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Certain Terms And To Define Additional Terms Used In The Act; To Amend Section 37-23-194, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Blind And Visually Impaired Students Receive Educational Services From Certified Blindness Assessment Specialists; To Amend Section 37-23-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Appropriate Educational Entity To Provide For Instruction In Braille And The Use Of Braille Unless The Iep Committee Determines, After An Evaluation Of The Child's Needs, If Instruction In Braille Or The Use Of Braille Is Not Appropriate For The Child; To Require Assessments For Students To Include A Minimum Research-based Learning Media Assessment; To Prohibit The Denial Of Instruction In Braille To Students With Some Residual Vision; To Amend Section 37-23-197, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Standard Procedure To Be Used By The Iep Or 504 Team That Braille Instruction Or The Use Of Braille Is Required For Blind Students; To Require The Iep Or 504 Team To Base Its Decision On The Current Ability And Needs And Future Needs Of Students, While Considering The Appropriate Reading And Writing Media For Children With Some Residual Vision; To Amend Section 37-23-199, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Textbook Publishers That Sell Books To Mississippi School Districts To Furnish American Standard Code For Information Interchange (ascii) Or Other Electronically Formatted Files Compatible With Braille Conversion For All Books And Supplementary Materials For Literary And Nonliterary Subjects; To Require The State Board Of Education To Promulgate And Publish Regulations, Policies And Procedures For The Administrative Operation Of The Mississippi Instructional Resource Center; To Amend Section 37-23-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Certification Qualifications For Specialists In Braille Who Serve On The Advisory Committee; To Establish The Time Within Which The State Superintendent Of Public Education Has To Respond To The Recommendations Of The Advisory Committee; To Amend Section 37-23-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Recognize Braille And Orientation And Mobility As Core Subject Areas For All Blind Students; To Require The Department To Adopt A Minimum Standard For Teachers Of The Blind Certified On Or Before January 1, 2012, And Thereafter; To Establish The Method For Determining Competency In Reading And Writing Of Literary Braille And Nemeth Code; To Authorize The State Board Of Education To Establish Additional Requirements For Teachers Or Instructors Of Blind Students; And For Related Purposes.

2814.title: Appropriation; Mississippi Adequate Education.
2814.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program For The Fiscal Year 2013.

2815.title: Dirt bikes; require certain minors to wear helmets and receive training.
2815.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Minors Operating A Dirt Bike To Receive Off-road Vehicle Training And To Wear A Proper Helmet; To Revise The Approval Of Helmets That Satisfy Safety Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2818.title: County board of supervisors; reduce notice required to call emergency meetings.
2818.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise How A Board Of Supervisors May Call An Emergency Meeting; And For Related Purposes.

2819.title: Regional and municipal airport authorities; revise powers and duties.
2819.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The Powers And Authority Of The Executive Director Of The Airport Authority; To Amend Section 61-3-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Establishment Of Airport Authority Fire Departments; To Authorize Airport Authorities To Enter Into Joint Use Or Similar Agreements With The United States Of America And The State Of Mississippi; To Authorize Airport Authorities To Enter Into Mutual Aid Agreements; To Amend Section 61-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Lease Of Oil, Gas And Mineral Interests; To Amend Section 61-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Municipalities To Provide Services On Authority Property; To Establish A Procedure For Airport Authorities To Enforce Commercial Aircraft Liens; To Amend Section 61-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Municipalities To Enter Into Joint Use Or Similar Agreements With The United States Of America And The State Of Mississippi; To Establish A Procedure For Municipalities To Enforce Commercial Aircraft Liens; And For Related Purposes.

2821.title: Energy efficiency standards; revise for commercial buildings.
2821.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-39-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Energy Efficiency Standards For Commercial Buildings; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Not Have Enforcement Authority Over This Section Of Law; And For Related Purposes.

2823.title: MS Wireless Communication Commission; revise authority regarding local government entities.
2823.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The Mississippi Wireless Communication Commission To Approve All Wireless Communications Systems Owned Or Operated By Any Local Government Entity; And For Related Purposes.

2824.title: Solid waste; provide that property can not be sold to satisfy only garbage liens.
2824.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-22, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Property Can Not Be Sold To Satisfy Only Garbage Liens; And For Related Purposes.

2825.title: Cash-basis audits; authorize for counties with less than $20,000,000.00 in revenue.
2825.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties With Total Annual Revenues Of Less Than $20,000,000.00 To Supply Cash-basis Audits; And For Related Purposes.

2826.title: Property; authorize exchange of between MS Transportation Commission and GM&O Rails to Trails Recreational District of North MS.
2826.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Gm&o Rails To Trails Recreational District Of North Mississippi To Exchange Real Property Located In Pontotoc County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2827.title: Public buildings; require art by Mississippi artists in certain state buildings.
2827.description: An Act To Create The Allocation For Art For Public Facilities Act; To Declare Legislative Intent And Purpose; To Require State Agencies To Expend, Out Of Monies Allocated For Original Construction, Remodeling Or Renovation Of Any State Facility, A Certain Percentage For The Purpose Of Including Works Of Art By Mississippi Artists In Such Facility; To Establish In The State Treasury The "art For Public Facilities Fund"; To Authorize The Mississippi Museum Of Art To Administer This Act; To Provide That The State Of Mississippi Shall Receive The Right To Sole Ownership And Public Display Of All Art Acquired Under The Act, Subject To Certain Rights Retained By The Artist; And For Related Purposes.

2828.title: Landmark Building; authorize DFA to acquire.
2828.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Department Of Revenue, To Acquire Certain Real Property Also Known As The "landmark Center" Located At 175 East Capitol Street In The City Of Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi; To Amend Sections 29-5-2 And 29-5-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, To Remove The Authority To Issue State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 For Planning, Design And Phase I Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Headquarters Building For The Department Of Revenue To Be Located On State-owned Property In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, At A Site Selected By The Department Of Finance And Administration; And For Related Purposes.

2829.title: Tax-forfeited lands; Secretary of State may consider cost of cleanup when determining the price for the sale of.
2829.description: An Act To Amend Sections 29-1-35 And 29-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Consider The Cost Of Cleanup And Removal Of Debris When Determining The Price For The Sale Of Tax-forfeited Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: Board of Pharmacy; authorize DFA to purchase and sell property on behalf of new facility.
2830.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Mississippi Board Of Pharmacy, To Purchase Certain Real Property For The Use And Benefit Of The Board; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Negotiate All Aspects Of The Purchase And Any Terms And Ancillary Agreements Pertaining To The Purchase; To Provide That No State General Funds,special Funds Or State Appropriations Shall Be Used By The Department Of Finance And Administration For The Purchase Of The Real Property; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Sell And Convey, Lease Or Enter Into A Lease-purchase Agreement For Certain State-owned Real Property Currently Used By The Mississippi Board Of Pharmacy As Its Operating Facilities; To Require Monies Derived From The Sale Or Lease Of That Property To Be Used To Offset The Expenditures Associated With The Purchase Of A New Operating Facility; To Provide That Monies Received In Excess Of The Amount Needed For The Purchase Of A New Operating Facility And Such Other Ancillary Matters Relating To The Purchase To Be Deposited Into A Special Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Being Disbursed To The Mississippi Board Of Pharmacy; To Stipulate The Requirements For Advertising And Entering Into A Contract For The Sale, Lease Or Lease-purchase Of The Existing Board Facility; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Correct Discrepancies In The Legal Descriptions Of The Real Properties In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2831.title: Mississippi S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; revise various licensing provisions and extend repeal date.
2831.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-18-1 Through 81-18-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "housing Finance Agency" As Used In The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From The Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Application Requirements For Licensure; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Surety Bond Requirement For Mortgage Loan Originators; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Department's Authority To Issue A License When An Applicant Or Person Convicted Of A Crime Has Received An Expungement Of The Crime; To Amend Reenacted Sections 81-18-17 And 81-18-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Signage Requirements For Each Principal Place Of Business And Branch Office; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Correct A Typographical Error; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Each Licensee Shall Include The Date Of Loan Closing In His Journal Of Mortgage Transactions; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 81-18-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Clarifying Language Regarding The Applicability Of The Chapter To Activities Of Owner Financing; To Create A New Section To Provide Servicing Requirements For Mortgage Lenders; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Budget Contingency Fund; all funds received by State from settlement in connection with oil spill shall be deposited into.
2832.description: An Act To Provide That All Funds Received By The State Of Mississippi Through A Negotiated Settlement For Economic Damages In Connection With The Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Shall Be Deposited Into The Budget Contingency Fund For Appropriation By The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2833.title: Budget Contingency Fund; transfer certain funds to.
2833.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer Certain Amounts To The Budget Contingency Fund From The State General Fund And Certain Special Funds During Fiscal Years 2012 And 2013; To Amend Section 43-13-407, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer A Certain Amount Of Dollars From The Health Care Trust Fund To The Health Care Expendable Fund In Fiscal Year 2013; To Amend Sections 27-7-309, 27-65-33 And 27-67-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Early Payment Of Withholding, Sales And Use Tax Liability By Certain Taxpayers And To Delay Until 2013 The Implementation Of The Increase In The Amount Of The Average Monthly Liability That Triggers The Requirement For Early Payment; To Allow The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency The Option Of Using The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Funds And/or The Budget Contingency Fund For Disaster Assistance; To Repeal Section 4, Chapter 126, Laws Of 2009 Second Extraordinary Session, Which Requires The State Of Mississippi To Repay A Certain Amount Of Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: Payday lending; prohibit activities of/declare public nuisance.
2834.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Intent To Prohibit Activities Commonly Referred To As Payday Lending, Deferred Presentment Services, Advance Cash Services And Other Similar Activities; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Engage In The Business Of Making Certain Small Loans; To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Provide For Collection Of Civil Penalties In Actions By The State Or By Private Parties On Behalf Of The State; To Declare The Site Or Location Of A Place Of Business Where Payday Lending Takes Place In The State Of Mississippi As A Public Nuisance; To Repeal Sections 75-67-401 Through 75-67-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Title Pledge Act; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: Appraisal management companies; clarify that registration period is valid for one year.
2835.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-34-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Registration Granted By The Mississippi Real Estate Commission For Appraisal Management Companies Shall Be Valid For One Year Instead Of Two Years; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: Contractors; must obtain authorization before negotiating certain checks.
2836.description: An Act To Create A Right On Behalf Of Certain Subcontractors To Payments Made To A Subcontractor For Materials Or Equipment Furnished Or Labor Performed By The Subcontractor; To Create The Misdemeanor Of Negotiating A Draft For A Payment Owed To A Subcontractor Without Authorization And To Create Penalties Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2837.title: MS Real Estate Commission; may increase fees for licensure of appraisal management companies.
2837.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-34-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Fees Which May Be Charged By The Mississippi Real Estate Commission For The Initial And Renewal Licenses Of Appraisal Management Companies; To Amend Section 73-34-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Applicant For Registration As An Appraisal Management Company To Submit A Surety Bond Payable To The State Of Mississippi, And To Clarify That The Registration Period Is Annual Instead Of Biennial; And For Related Purposes.

2838.title: State Board of Contractors; revise various licensing laws.
2838.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Contractors, Through Rule Or Regulation, To Establish The Threshold Amounts For Licensure Whereby Any Contract, Subcontract Or Undertaking Is Deemed Hazardous Or High Risk To Public Safety; To Amend Section 31-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Contractors To Require Any Contractor Who Is Licensed By The Board To Provide A Surety Bond In An Amount Determined To Be Sufficient To Cover Any Construction Projects Throughout The State; To Amend Section 17-25-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Every Municipality And County Of The State Of Mississippi To Grant Competency Examination Reciprocity To Any Contractor Who Is A Holder Of A Certificate Of Responsibility Issued By The State Board Of Contractors; To Amend Section 73-59-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Licensed Residential Builders And Remodelers Performing Commercial Construction To Identify His Subcontractors On The Project; To Bring Forward Sections 31-3-21 And 27-7-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2839.title: Private construction contracts; contractor shall furnish a payment bond when contract over a certain amount.
2839.description: An Act To Require Any Contractor Or Subcontractor Entering Into Certain Contracts For The Construction, Alteration Or Repair Of Any Private Work To Furnish A Payment Bond With Good And Sufficient Surety; To Provide For The Right To Sue On The Payment Bond For The Unpaid Labor Furnished Or Material Used During The Work Provided For In The Contract; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: Residential property foreclosures; prohibit unless 90-day written notice is given.
2840.description: An Act To Prohibit Foreclosure On Residential Property Unless The Mortgagee Or Holder Of The Mortgage Gives The Mortgagor 90 Days' Written Notice; To Prescribe The Contents Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Mortgagee To Notify The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance Of The Date Of The Foreclosure Sale, The Purchase Price Obtained At The Sale, And A Copy Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Maintain A Database Of Certain Foreclosure Activity Information; And For Related Purposes.

2841.title: Transfer of funds to Governor's Mansion Special Fund; authorize.
2841.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer To Transfer A Certain Amount To A Special Fund For The Governor's Office And Governor's Mansion From Special Fund No. 3996 For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expense Of Unused Accrued Personal Leave Pursuant To Section 25-3-93(4), Mississippi Code Of 1972, And For Other Related Expenses, For Fiscal Years 2012 And 2013.

2842.title: "Mississippi Strategic Planning and Performance Budgeting System Act of 2012"; enact.
2842.description: An Act To Enact The "mississippi Strategic Planning And Performance Budget System Enhancement Act Of 2012"; To Define Certain Terms; To Establish A Process For Statewide Strategic Planning And Agency Budgeting; To Require That Certain Functions Be Carried Out By The Legislative Budget Committee And The Legislative Budget Office; To Provide For The Annual Preparation Of A Strategic Plan For The Operation Of All State Agencies To Comply With The Goals For Each Area In Which The Agencies Provide Services; To Provide For Individual Agency Strategic Plans Based Upon The State Plan To Be Submitted Annually By State Agencies; To Provide That Funds To State Agencies Shall Be Budgeted And Appropriated Based Upon The Agency Strategic Plans; To Prescribe The Components Of The Strategic Plans; To Require Achievement Goals For Each Functional Area Of State Government To Be Incorporated In The Agency Strategic Plan, And To Direct The Legislative Budget Office To Establish A System Of Performance Audits And Evaluations To Determine The Extent To Which State Agencies Are Complying With The Adopted Performance Goals As Prescribed In The Agencies Appropriation Bill; To Provide That Beginning With The 2015 Regular Session The Legislature Shall Enact Nine Appropriation Bills To Defray The Expenses Of All State General-fund And Special-fund Agencies Based Upon Certain Functional Areas To Conform With The Adopted State Agency Strategic Plan; To Provide For Certain Duties Of The Peer Committee Relating To Performance Monitoring Of Agency Budgets And To Grant To The Peer Committee The Power Of Compulsory Process And Power Of Enforcement; To Direct Lbc To Establish An Agency Innovation Incentive Program; To Codify Sections 5-3-68 And 5-3-70 And To Amend Sections 5-3-59, 27-103-101, 27-103-103, 27-103-111, 27-103-129, 27-103-131, 27-103-137 And 27-103-211, And To Bring Forward Section 27-103-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 27-104-3 And 27-104-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Empower The Department Of Finance And Administration And Its Executive Director To Provide State Agencies With Training Regarding Strategic Planning And Budgeting; To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Midyear Budget Revisions Shall Be Made From The Lowest Priority Programs As Identified By The Legislature; To Repeal Sections 27-103-121, 27-103-123, 27-103-125 And 27-103-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Budgeting Practices; To Repeal Sections 27-103-151 Through 27-103-157, And 27-103-209, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Budget And Strategic Planning Act Of 1994; And For Related Purposes.

2843.title: Peanut Promotion Board; MS Farm Bureau to make appointments as terms expire.
2843.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-48-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Farm Bureau Federation, Inc., Shall Make Appointments To The Mississippi Peanut Promotion Board As The Terms Expire; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: Agriculture; remove the prospective change in maximum amount of loans of the Emerging Crops Fund.
2844.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Prospective Changer In The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of Loans Available Under The Emerging Crops Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2845.title: Egg Marketing Board; assessments to be remitted to foundation for marketing purposes.
2845.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-7-263, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Egg Marketing Assessments Be Remitted To A Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

2846.title: Mississippi Fair Commission; authorize to contract for advertising on buildings.
2846.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-5-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Fair Commission To Contract With Commercial, Charitable, Or Governmental Entities To Advertise The Entity's Name In Connection With Buildings On The State Fairgrounds; And For Related Purposes.

2847.title: Agricultural crimes; revise crime of livestock theft.
2847.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Theft Of Livestock; And For Related Purposes.

2848.title: MS Athletic Commission; may fix salary of its secretary without approval of State Personnel Board.
2848.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-75-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Mississippi Athletic Commission To Fix The Salary Of Its Secretary Without The Approval Of The State Personnel Board; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: State Auditor; authorize to contract with independent specialists or firms to assist in the performance of an audit.
2849.description: An Act To Amend Sections 7-7-211 And 7-7-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Auditor To Contract With Independent Specialists And To Provide That Costs Paid For The Independent Specialists Shall Be Paid By The Audited Entity Through The State Auditor To The Specialist Firm; To Amend Section 29-9-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Department Of Audit In Regard To The Physical Audit Of State Agencies Of The Actual Items Shown On Their Inventories And Related Records; And For Related Purposes.

2850.title: Constables; revise compensation when serving as justice court bailiff.
2850.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-19-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount Of Compensation For Constables When Serving As Justice Court Bailiff; And For Related Purposes.

2851.title: State-owned vehicles; provide moratorium on purchase of and reduce total number over certain period of time.
2851.description: An Act To Provide That From July 1, 2012, Through June 30, 2013, The Bureau Of Fleet Management, Department Of Finance And Administration, Shall Not Approve The Purchase, Lease Or Acquisition Of A Motor Vehicle By A State Agency; To Require Certain State Agencies To Reduce The Total Number Of Motor Vehicles Each Year By A Certain Percentage; To Provide For Exemptions To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2852.title: State boards and commissions; bring forward for amendment purposes.
2852.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 69-7-101 (central Market Board), 41-111-1 (child Death Review Panel), 19-5-333 (commercial Mobile Radio Service Board), 45-39-3 (crime Stoppers Advisory Council), 37-21-51 (early Learning Collaboration Grant Program), 73-69-21 (electronic Protection Licensing Advisory Board), 43-13-409 (health Care Trust Fund), 41-73-7 (mississippi Hospital Equipment Facilities Authority), 57-83-1 (mississippi Technology Alliance Liaison Committee) And 43-59-3 (mississippi Commission On The Status Of Women), Mississippi Code Of 1972, And Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 2004 (capitol City Convention Center Commission),for Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2853.title: Executive Director of Mississippi Development Authority; remove salary cap and allow supplement with funds from any source.
2853.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Salary Of The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Development Authority May Be Greater Than 150% Of The Salary Of The Governor And May Be Supplemented With Funds From Any Source; And For Related Purposes.

2854.title: State-owned vehicles; authorize unmarked vehicles for the Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Reservoir Patrol.
2854.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District To Own Or Lease Unmarked Vehicles For Use By The Reservoir Patrol; And For Related Purposes.

2855.title: Tax assessors and collectors; increase salaries.
2855.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Tax Assessors And Collectors; And For Related Purposes.

2856.title: Public purchasing; DFA shall adopt regulations governing the purchasing of services by state agencies.
2856.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-7-9 And 31-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Adopt Purchasing Regulations Governing The Purchase By Any Agency Of Any Service, Subject To The Approval By The Public Procurement Review Board; To Amend Section 31-7-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Agencies To Purchase Services At The State Contract Price From The Approved Source, Unless Approval Is Granted By The Department Of Finance And Administration; To Amend Section 31-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Rebates, Refunds, Coupons, Merit Points, Gratuities Or Any Article Of Value Received By Any Agency Shall Inure To The Benefit Of The Department Of Finance And Administration And Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2857.title: Roofing Contractor Registration Act; create.
2857.description: An Act To Create The "roofing Contractor Registration Act"; To Define Certain Terms; To Require Roofing Contractor Registration With The State Board Of Contractors; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of The Act; To Authorize Employment Of Personnel Subject To Funding; To Allow Promulgation Of Forms By The State Board Of Contractors; To Provide Application Procedure And To Require Liability Insurance In Minimal Amounts; To Require Certain Notification Upon Insurance Cancelation Or Lapse; To Require Proof Of Workers' Compensation Coverage Or Exemption; To Require Certain Statements Under Oath On The Application And Renewal Forms; To Provide Grounds For Refusal To Issue Roofing Contractor Registration; To Provide Registration Fees; To Require Registration To Be Issued Or Denied Within A Certain Time Period; To Require Notification For Changes To Registrant Information; To Provide For The Renewal Of A Registration Certificate; To Allow Public Inspection Of Roofing Contractor Registration; To Create The Roofing Contractor Registration Special Fund In The State Treasury; And For Related Purposes.

2858.title: MS SAFE Mortgage Act; exempt small loan companies with mortgage lending activities under a certain amount.
2858.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act Small Loan Companies With Mortgage Lending Activities That Are Limited Solely To Loans Under A Certain Amount; And For Related Purposes.

2859.title: Appropriation; MS Gulf Coast Community College Motion Picture Industry Workforce Training for fiscal year 2013.
2859.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College For The Purpose Of Providing Motion Picture Industry Workforce Training In Coordination With The Mississippi Film Office For Fiscal Year 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2860.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for the Mississippi Watershed Repair and Rehabilitation Cost-Share Program.
2860.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Watershed Repair And Rehabilitation Cost-share Program; To Amend Section 51-37-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2865.title: Tunica County; may contribute to the Tunica County Museum.
2865.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Tunica County Museum, Inc., For The Purpose Of Operating And Maintaining A Public Museum In Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

2866.title: Income tax; authorize credit for payments to a college or research corporation for experimental, developmental or research work.
2866.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Make Payments To A College Or Research Corporation Pursuant To A Written Contract, Grant Or Cooperative Agreement Entered Into Between The Taxpayer And A College Or Research Corporation For The Performance Of Experimental, Developmental Or Research Work; And For Related Purposes.

2867.title: City of Hattiesburg; city may enter into certain contracts, operations agreements and leases regarding its wastewater systems.
2867.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts For The Collection, Storage, Transportation, Treatment And/or Disposal Of Wastewater; To Authorize The City To Enter Into Operating Agreements For The Operation Of All Or Any Portions Of The City's Wastewater Collection, Storage, Transportation, Treatment Or Other Systems; To Authorize The City To Lease To Or From Any Person All Or Any Portions Of The City's Wastewater Collection, Storage, Transportation, Treatment Or Other Systems; To Authorize Such Contracts, Agreements Or Leases To Be For A Term Not To Exceed 30 Years; To Provide The Manner Of Awarding Such Contracts, Operating Agreements Or Leases That Involve The Expenditure By The City Of More Than $50,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2870.title: George County; may issue bonds for a recreational complex and impose a sales tax to retire the bonds.
2870.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of George County, Mississippi, To Issue General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Acquiring, Constructing, Equipping And Furnishing A County Recreational Complex; To Provide For A Tax Upon Gross Proceeds Of Sales In George County, Which Shall Be Expended By The Board Of Supervisors To Retire The Bonds; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To George County; To Provide That The Bonds Shall Not Be Issued And The Tax Shall Not Be Imposed Unless Approved At An Election Held In The County On That Question; And For Related Purposes.

2873.title: Kemper County; authorize a contribution to Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.
2873.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2874.title: Appropriation FY13; Mississippi Commission on the Status of Women.
2874.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Commission On The Status Of Women For Fiscal Year 2013.

2875.title: Parents who send children to private school or homeschool; provide state income tax deduction for.
2875.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A State Income Tax Deduction For Parents Who Send Their Children Or Dependents To A Private School Or A Homeschool Program; And For Related Purposes.

2877.title: Bonds; authorize for reconstruction, repair and renovation of the Maritime and Seafood Industry Museum.
2877.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Reconstruction, Repair And Renovation Of The Maritime And Seafood Industry Museum In Biloxi, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2878.title: City of Florence; extend repeal date on tax on bars and restaurants.
2878.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 939, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 1046, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Town Of Florence To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of The Sales Of Bars And Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

2879.title: Lafayette County; establish the Lafayette County Reserve and Trust Fund.
2879.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Establish A Reserve And Trust Fund; To Provide That Proceeds Received By The County As A Result Of The Termination Of Lease And For The Sale Of The Real And Personal Property Related To The Baptist Memorial Hospital-north Mississippi Facilities Located On Lamar Avenue May Be Deposited Into The Fund; To Provide For The Establishment Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Reserve And Trust Fund And Provide That Its Membership Shall Be The Members Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Board Of Trustees; To Provide For The Investment Of The Assets Of The Trust Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Divided Into A Corpus Component And An Earning Component; To Provide That The Corpus Component Shall Remain Inviolate Except As Otherwise Provided In This Act; To Provide That The Earnings Component Shall Be Transferred From The Trust Fund To The General Fund Of The County And Shall Be Available For Appropriation And Spending By The Board Of Supervisors Of The County; To Authorize Money From The Corpus Of The Trust To Be Expended By The County Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2880.title: Sand Creek Wastewater Authority; create.
2880.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County To Create The Sand Creek Wastewater Authority; To Provide That The Authority Shall Be Governed By A Board Of Directors; To Provide For The Membership Of The Board Of Directors; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Authority; To Authorize The Authority To Acquire, Construct, Maintain And Operate Wastewater Systems For Areas Served By Its Member Agencies; To Authorize Wastewater Providers To Contract With The Authority; To Authorize Its Member Agencies To Contract With Nonmember Agencies With Approval Of The Authority; To Authorize The Sand Creek Wastewater Authority To Issue Revenue Bonds To Provide Funds Necessary To Achieve The Purposes Of This Act; To Authorize The Sand Creek Wastewater Authority, With The Approval Of The Affected Wastewater Provider, To Enter Into Contracts With The Owners Of Property To Provide Improvements Necessary To Provide Wastewater Services; To Provide That The Authority May Issue Special Assessment Bonds To Finance Such Improvements And To Authorize The Authority To Levy And Collect Special Assessments Against The Property Benefited Thereby To Retire Such Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

2881.title: Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Act; create and provide certain tax credits for qualified businesses located in.
2881.description: An Act To Be Entitled The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Act; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority (mda) To Certify Health Care Industry Zones In Areas That Are Located Within A Five-mile Radius Of A County Which Has Certificates Of Need Of More Than 375 Acute Care Hospital Beds; To Authorize The Mda To Certify Health Care Industry Facilities In The Health Care Industry Zone And Certain Businesses As Qualified Businesses Under The Act; To Provide That Such Qualified Businesses Shall Be Eligible For An Accelerated State Income Tax Depreciation Deduction, For Certain Sales Tax Exemptions, For An Ad Valorem Tax Exemption And For A Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes; To Provide That If The Qualified Business Has Not Created The Requisite Number Of Jobs Required By This Act, The Health Care Industry Zone Certification May Be Revoked By Mda After Five Years Have Elapsed From The Effective Date Of Certification; To Provide That A Revocation Under This Section Shall Not Act Retroactively To Remove Any Incentives Granted By This Act; To Amend Section 27-31-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Authorities To Grant An Ad Valorem Tax Exemption To Health Care Industry Facilities; To Amend Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisor And The Governing Authorities Of Municipalities To Grant A Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes To Qualified Businesses As Defined In This Act That Meet Minimum Criteria Established By The Mda; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Materials Used In The Construction Of A Health Care Industry Facility, As Defined In This Act, Or Any Addition Or Improvement Thereon, And Sales Of Any Machinery And Equipment Not Later Than Three Months After The Completion Of Construction Of The Building, Or Any Addition Thereon, To Be Used In The Building, To Qualified Businesses, As Defined In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2883.title: Tobacco Tax Law; include in the term "cigarette" certain roll your own products.
2883.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-69-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Under The Tobacco Tax Law The Word "cigarette" Includes Products Made By A Consumer At A Retail Establishment Using A Machine To Fabricate, Assemble Or Process At That Retail Establishment Tobacco Products Into A Roll Or Tube For Smoking; And For Related Purposes.

2884.title: Tobacco equity tax; increase.
2884.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-70-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Tobacco Equity Tax Paid By Distributors Of Cigarettes Manufactured By Cigarette Manufacturers Who Are Not A Party To The Tobacco Settlement Agreement; And For Related Purposes.

2885.title: Tobacco Tax Law; provide for the tax on little cigars.
2885.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-69-3, 27-69-13 And 27-69-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Little Cigars For Purposes Of The Tobacco Tax Law; To Provide That Little Cigars Shall Be Taxed Under The Tobacco Tax Law At The Same Rate As Cigarettes; And For Related Purposes.

2886.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.
2886.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,540,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2887.title: Franchise and sales tax exemption; MDA may grant businesses that receive funds from the Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund.
2887.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Grant An Approved Business Enterprise That Is Approved For A Loan Or Grant From The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund, An Exemption From The Franchise Tax For A Period Of Time Not To Exceed 10 Years; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Grant A Business Enterprise That Invests A Minimum Of $20,000,000.00 In Buildings And Equipment And Creates A Minimum Of 50 New Full-time Jobs, An Exemption From The Franchise Tax For A Period Of Time Not To Exceed 10 Years; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Component Materials Used In The Construction Of A Project, Or Any Addition Or Improvement To The Project, And Sales Or Leases Of Machinery And Equipment Not Later Than Three Months After The Completion Of Construction Of The Project, Or Any Addition Or Improvement To The Project, To Be Used In The Building Or Addition Or Improvement, To An Approved Business Enterprise That Receives A Grant Or Loan From The Mississippi Industry Incentive Financing Revolving Fund, If The Mississippi Development Authority Authorizes The Exemption In An Agreement With The Approved Business Enterprise; And For Related Purposes.

2888.title: Bonds; authorize to assist in the establishment of the GRAMMY Museum in Cleveland, Mississippi.
2888.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Cleveland Music Foundation In Paying The Costs Of Design, Fabrication And Installation Of The Permanent Exhibition At The New Grammy Museum In Cleveland, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2889.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on power & fuel sold to a producer of oil and gas for use in oil recovery and the sequestration of CO2.
2889.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Sale Of Electricity, Current, Power, Steam, Coal, Natural Gas, Liquefied Petroleum Gas Or Other Fuel To A Producer Of Oil And Gas For Use Directly In Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects And The Permanent Sequestration Of Carbon Dioxide In A Geological Formation Shall Be Taxed At The Rate Of 1-1/2%; And For Related Purposes.

2890.title: Income tax; authorize deduction for retrofitting of residences in coastal counties to mitigate damages from certain weather events.
2890.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Individual Taxpayers Whose Legal Residence Is In Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, George, Stone Or Pearl River Counties For Certain Costs Of Retrofitting Their Residence With Certain Fortification Measures That Are Designed To Increase The Resistance Of The Residence To Hurricane, Tornado, Or Catastrophic Windstorm Event Damage; To Provide The Amount Of The Deduction; And For Related Purposes.

2891.title: Appropriation; IHL - General support.
2891.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities For Fiscal Year 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2892.title: Appropriation; IHL - Subsidiary programs.
2892.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities' Designated Institutes, Laboratories And Programs For Which They Are Responsible And The Executive Office Of The Board Of Trustees For Fiscal Year 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2893.title: Appropriation; IHL - Student Financial Aid.
2893.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support And Maintenance Of Financial Aid Scholarship, Loan And Grant Programs And The Mississippi Office Of Student Financial Aid, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2894.title: Appropriation; IHL - University of Mississippi Medical Center.
2894.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center For Fiscal Year 2013.

2895.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State - Agricultural programs.
2895.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs For Fiscal Year 2013.

2896.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Agricultural and Forestry Experiment Station.
2896.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Agricultural And Forestry Experiment Station For Fiscal Year 2013.

2897.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Cooperative Extension Service.
2897.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service For Fiscal Year 2013.

2898.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Forest and Wildlife Research Center.
2898.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Incurred In The Maintenance And Operation Of The Forest And Wildlife Research Center For Fiscal Year 2013.

2899.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Veterinary Medicine, College of.
2899.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The College Of Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2900.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Administrative expenses.
2900.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The Mississippi Community College Board For Fiscal Year 2013.

2901.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Support for community and junior colleges.
2901.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2013.

2902.title: Appropriation; Corrections, Department of.
2902.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections For Fiscal Year 2013.

2903.title: Appropriation; Emergency Management Agency.
2903.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency, And For The Purpose Of Establishing A Disaster Relief Reserve Fund And Defraying The Costs Related To Certain Disaster Assistance Programs, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2904.title: Appropriation; Military Department.
2904.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi National Guard For Fiscal Year 2013.

2905.title: Appropriation; Public Safety, Department of.
2905.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Public Safety For Fiscal Year 2013.

2906.title: Appropriation; Veterans Affairs Board.
2906.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans Affairs Board For Fiscal Year 2013.

2907.title: Appropriation; Judicial Performance Commission.
2907.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission On Judicial Performance Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2013.

2908.title: Appropriation; Ethics Commission.
2908.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Ethics Commission For The Fiscal Year 2013.

2909.title: Appropriation; Banking and Consumer Finance, Department of.
2909.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Support Of The State Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance For Fiscal Year 2013.

2910.title: Appropriation; Employment Security, Department of.
2910.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For Fiscal Year 2013.

2911.title: Appropriation; Revenue, Department of.
2911.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Revenue, Including The Homestead Exemption Division, The Motor Vehicle Comptroller Functions, The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division, And The Bureau Of Telecommunications; For The Purpose Of Reimbursing The Counties, County Districts And Municipal Separate School Districts For Tax Losses Incurred By Reason Of The Exemption Of Homes From Certain Ad Valorem Taxes; And For The Purpose Of Purchasing Motor Vehicle License Tags, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2912.title: Appropriation; Tax Appeals Board.
2912.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Board Of Tax Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2013.

2913.title: Appropriation; Workers' Compensation Commission.
2913.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Workers' Compensation Commission For Fiscal Year 2013.

2914.title: Appropriation; Mental Health, Department of.
2914.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Mental Health And Certain Programs Of The Division Of Alcohol And Drug Abuse, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2915.title: Appropriation; Development Authority, Mississippi.
2915.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Development Authority For Fiscal Year 2013.

2916.title: Appropriation; Gaming Commission.
2916.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2917.title: Appropriation; Transportation, Department of - State Aid Road Construction, Office of.
2917.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Office Of State Aid Road Construction Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Fiscal Year 2013.

2918.title: Appropriation; Chiropractic Examiners, Board of.
2918.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners For Fiscal Year 2013.

2919.title: Appropriation; Dental Examiners, Board of.
2919.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To The Mississippi State Board Of Dental Examiners For Fiscal Year 2013.

2920.title: Appropriation; Funeral Services Board.
2920.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Funeral Services For Fiscal Year 2013.

2921.title: Appropriation; Massage Therapy, Board of.
2921.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Massage Therapy, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2922.title: Appropriation; Pharmacy, Board of.
2922.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Pharmacy For Fiscal Year 2013.

2923.title: Appropriation; Counselors, Board of Examiners for Licensed Professional.
2923.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Examiners For Licensed Professional Counselors For Fiscal Year 2013.

2924.title: Appropriation; Veterinary Examiners, Board of.
2924.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Veterinary Examiners For Fiscal Year 2013.

2925.title: Appropriation; Architecture, Board of.
2925.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Architecture And Landscape Architecture Advisory Committee For Fiscal Year 2013.

2926.title: Appropriation; Geologists, Board of Registered Professional.
2926.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Registered Professional Geologists For Fiscal Year 2013.

2927.title: Appropriation; Motor Vehicle Commission.
2927.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Commission For Fiscal Year 2013.

2928.title: Appropriation; Accountancy, Board of Public.
2928.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Accountancy For Fiscal Year 2013.

2929.title: Appropriation; Contractors, Board of.
2929.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Contractors For Fiscal Year 2013.

2930.title: Appropriation; Agriculture and Commerce, Department of.
2930.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, For The Fiscal Year 2013.

2931.title: Appropriation; Egg Marketing Board.
2931.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2932.title: Appropriation; Animal Health, Board of.
2932.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board For Fiscal Year 2013.

2933.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission.
2933.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Fair Commission, The Mississippi Livestock Coliseum And The Industrial Showcase And Trade Mart Building For Fiscal Year 2013.

2934.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission - Livestock shows.
2934.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Fair Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Dixie National Livestock Show; A Roundup For Junior Exhibitors Of Livestock And Goats; Supplemental Funds For Livestock Premiums; County Livestock Shows In Offering And Paying Prizes Or Awards To Competitors In Approved County Livestock Shows; The Five District Livestock Shows; The Five State Dairy Shows; The Mississippi High School Rodeo; And To Provide How Said Money Shall Be Paid Out Of The State Treasury For Fiscal Year 2013.

2935.title: Appropriation; Tennessee-Tombigbee Waterway Development Authority.
2935.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway Development Authority For The Purposes Enumerated In Section 51-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2936.title: Appropriation; Finance and Administration, Department of.
2936.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2013.

2937.title: Appropriation; Governor's Office and Mansion.
2937.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For Expenses Of The Executive Department, Being The Governor's Office And Staff, And For Expenses Incidental To The Proper Operation Of The Governor's Mansion And Residence Of The Governor, For Fiscal Year 2013.

2938.title: Appropriation; Audit, Department of.
2938.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Audit For Fiscal Year 2013.

2939.title: Appropriation; Information Technology Services, Department of.
2939.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2013.

2940.title: Appropriation; Personnel Board.
2940.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Personnel Board For Fiscal Year 2013.

2941.title: Appropriation; Secretary of State.
2941.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2013.

2942.title: Appropriation; Treasurer's Office.
2942.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2013.

2943.title: Appropriation; Debt service and bank service charges.
2943.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2013, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2013.

2944.title: City of Natchez/Adams County; authorize contributions to Natchez, Inc.
2944.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Natchez, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Organized For Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2945.title: Bonds; create the Municipal Utility Service Expansion Revolving Loan Fund and issue general obligation bonds for.
2945.description: An Act To Create The Municipal Utility Service Expansion Revolving Loan Fund To Provide Loans To Municipalities To Assist In The Expansion Of Municipal Water, Sewer And Natural Gas Utility Services Into Unincorporated Areas; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Small Project Development Financing Revolving Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2947.title: Bonds; authorize for the Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center.
2947.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Building, Equipping And Furnishing Facilities At The Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center In Tremont, Mississippi, And To Provide Funds For The Purchase Of Additional Land For The Center; And For Related Purposes.

2949.title: Local System Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to provide funds for.
2949.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $20,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Section 65-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2950.title: City of D'Iberville; revise purpose for which gaming fees may be expended.
2950.description: An Act To Revise The Purposes For Which The Governing Authorities Of The City Of D'iberville May Expend Revenue From The Fees Imposed On The Gross Revenue Of Cruise Vessels Which Dock In The Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2951.title: Appropriation FY13; funds for paying the costs of the permanent exhibition at the new GRAMMY Museum in Cleveland, MS.
2951.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of State General Funds To The Department Of Finance And Administration For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Assist The Cleveland Music Foundation In Paying The Costs Of Design, Fabrication And Installation Of The Permanent Exhibition At The New Grammy Museum In Cleveland, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2953.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for the Marty Stuart Center and Congress of Country Music Hall.
2953.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping The Marty Stuart Center And Congress Of Country Music Hall In Philadelphia, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2954.title: Satellite broadcasting service providers; impose a tax on the gross revenue of.
2954.description: An Act To Impose A Tax On The Gross Revenue Of Satellite Broadcasting Service Providers Derived From Providing Satellite Broadcasting Service To A Subscriber In This State; To Provide That A Portion Of The Revenue Collected As A Result Of The Tax To Be Deposited Into The Integrated Public Safety Communications Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2956.title: City of Hernando; authorize contributions to Hernando Youth Sports, Inc., for the benefit of the Hernando Civic Center Park.
2956.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Hernando, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Hernando Civic Center And Hernando Youth Sports Through Calendar Year 2016 So Long As The Donated Funds Are To Be Utilized To Operate, Maintain And Improve Or Manage The Hernando Civic Center As A Public Park; And For Related Purposes.

2957.title: Lafayette County; extend authority to contribute to the Oxford Lafayette County Economic Development Foundation.
2957.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 933, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Extend Through Fiscal Year 2015, The Authority Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Oxford-lafayette County Economic Development Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

2959.title: Town of Bayhalia; extend repeal date on hotel and motel tax.
2959.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2010, To Extend The Repeal Date From July 1, 2012, To July 1, 2016, On The Law That Authorizes The Town Of Byhalia, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals For Hotels Or Motels In The Town; And For Related Purposes.

2961.title: Marshall County; change the name of the Cayce Community Sewer District to the Marshall Utility Services Sewer District.
2961.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 947, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, To Change The Name Of The Cayce Community Sewer District To The Marshall Utility Services Sewer District; And For Related Purposes.

2963.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize a sales tax to pay for a sports complex and/or recreational facility and related facilities.
2963.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Levy A Special Sales Tax At The Rate Of 1/2 Of 1% Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Or Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Any Of The Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law To Provide Funds For A State-of-the-art Sports Complex And/or Recreational Facility And Related Facilities; To Authorize The City To Issue General Obligation Bonds In An Aggregate Principal Amount Of Not To Exceed $20,000,000.00 To Be Expended To Purchase Property For, And For The Construction Of, A Sports Complex And/or Recreational Facility And Other Related Facilities; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; To Provide For The Tax To Be Discontinued Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2965.title: Yazoo Recreation Commission; authorize members to receive a per diem.
2965.description: An Act To Authorize Members Of The Recreation Commission Of The City Of Yazoo City And Yazoo County, Mississippi, To Be Paid A Per Diem For Each Day Or Portion Thereof Spent In The Performance Of Their Official Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2966.title: City of Gautier; authorize to impose a tax on restaurants, hotels and motels.
2966.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals; To Provide That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Expended By The City Of Gautier For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Improve Parks And Recreation Facilities For The Purpose Of Tourism And Economic Development Within The City; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Gautier; And For Related Purposes.

2967.title: City of Greenwood; authorize the levy of a tax on hotels and motels.
2967.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenwood, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In The City; To Provide That The Revenue From Such Tax Shall Be Utilized To Provide Funds To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

2969.title: Stone County; extend repeal date on provision authorizing certain assessment on misdemeanor convictions.
2969.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 929, Local And Private Laws Of 2009, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Authorizing The Board Of Supervisors Of Stone County To Levy An Assessment On Misdemeanor Convictions To Fund The "w.d. 'dub' Rustin Memorial Building"; And For Related Purposes.

3028.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting Mississippi Corrections Commissioner Christopher Epps As The Longest-serving Commissioner In The State's History, On The Occasion Of Black History Month.

3038.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Turquoise Council Of Americans And Eurasians And The Mississippi-turkish Hospitality Leadership Network And Welcoming The Foreign Dignitaries From Azerbaijan To Mississippi.

3039.title: Recognize mission of Turquoise Council of Americans and Eurasians and welcome dignitaries from Turkey to Mississippi.
3039.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting The Turquoise Council Of Americans And Eurasians And The Mississippi-turkish Hospitality Leadership Network And Welcoming Foreign Dignitaries From Turkey To Mississippi.

3040.title: Commend Olive Branch High School "Conquistadors" Football Team for winning 2011 MHSAA Class 6A State Championship.
3040.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Commend And Congratulate The Olive Branch High School "conquistadors" Football Team And Head Coach Scott Samsel For Winning The 2011 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Football Championship.

3041.title: Recognize Pan African Film & Arts Festival for naming "Rising Star" Award for Vicksburg native Beah Richards.
3041.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Saluting Mr. Ayuko Babu As Executive Director And Founder Of The Pan African Film & Arts Festival For Naming Their "rising Star" Award In Honor Of Vicksburg Native Beah Richards.

3042.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Clinton High School "arrows" Boys Soccer Team And Coach Jeff Long For Their Mhsaa Class 6a State Championship.

3043.title: Taxation; joint committee to study state tax system.
3043.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Create A Study Committee To Study The Tax System Of This State And To Make Recommendations Thereon To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

3044.title: Martin Luther King birthday; Legislature not convene.
3044.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring That The Legislature Shall Not Meet On The Third Monday Of January, Being The Legal Holiday Honoring The Birthday Of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.; That The New Capitol Building Shall Be Closed Except For Ceremonial Uses And That The Legislative, Gubernatorial And Other Employees Working In The New Capitol Building Shall Not Be Required To Work In Order To Observe That Legal Holiday; And For Related Purposes.

3045.title: Commend the members of Phi Theta Kappa's All-Mississippi Academic Team on the occasion of "Mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day."
3045.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Members Of Phi Theta Kappa's All-mississippi Academic Team On The Occasion Of "mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day."

3046.title: Designate April 22, 2012, as "Mississippi Earth Day 2012: Mobilize the Earth."
3046.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 42nd Anniversary Of Earth Day And Designating April 22, 2012, As "mississippi Earth Day 2012: Mobilize The Earth" And Urging All State Agencies And Citizens To Be Energy Stewards.

3047.title: Constitution; amend Section 121 to require the Governor to give at least 10 days' notice before convening an extraordinary session.
3047.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Governor To Give The Legislature At Least 10 Days' Notice Before Convening An Extraordinary Session, Except In Case Of An Emergency; And For Related Purposes.

3048.title: Commend life and legacy of Civil Rights leader and activist Dr. Cleveland Donald, Jr.
3048.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Cleveland Donald, Jr., An Icon Of The Civil Rights Movement From Newton, Mississippi, And Extending Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

3049.title: Constitution; amend Section 124 to require the Governor to hold a public hearing before granting a pardon for a felony.
3049.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 124 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Require The Governor To Hold A Public Hearing Before Granting A Pardon For A Felony As Required By Law.

3050.title: Constitution; amend Section 241 to allow felons to vote and restore civil rights upon meeting certain conditions.
3050.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Persons Convicted Of A Felony Shall Be Eligible To Vote And For Restoration Of Civil Rights Upon Meeting Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

3051.title: Constitution; create section protecting the life of every unborn child.
3051.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Create A New Section 14a To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Protect The Life Of An Unborn Child And To Declare That Our Certain Inalienable Rights Include The Right To Life Of Every Unborn Child.

3052.title: Constitution; prohibit pardon of certain violent crimes and revise notice requirements for other crimes.

3053.title: Constitution; amend Section 124 to require a favorable recommendation from the State Parole Board before the Governor can issue a pardon.
3053.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Governor May Grant Pardons And Commute Sentences Only Upon A Favorable Recommendation By The State Parole Board; And For Related Purposes.

3054.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Recreating Section 19 To Establish Hunting And Fishing As A Constitutional Right; And For Related Purposes.

3055.title: Constitution; amend Section 112 to allow single-family, owner-occupied real property that is not a primary residence to be Class I.
3055.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 112 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Provide That If The Primary Residence Of A Person Is Single-family, Owner-occupied Residential Real Property Located In This State And The Person Owns Other Single-family, Owner-occupied, Residential Real Property In This State, The Primary Residence Of The Person And One Other Owner-occupied Residential Real Property Of The Person's Choosing May Be Classified As Class I; To Provide That If The Property Chosen Is For Sale, That Property May Retain Its Class I Classification Only For 12 Months After The Date It Is Put On Sale.

3056.title: Constitution; amend Section 208 to allow the use of public funds for student aid to students attending religious schools.
3056.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 208 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Allow The Use Of Public Funds To Provide Grants, Scholarships, Loans Or Other Assistance To Students Attending Religious Schools.

3057.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Brandon High School "lady Bulldogs" Girls Soccer Team And Coach Celeste Bramlett For Winning Its First-ever Mhsaa Class 6a State Championship.

3058.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Columbia High School Marching Wildcats Band And Director Reuben Mcdowell For Winning The 2011 Mhsaa Class 4a State Championship And For Their Tradition Of Excellence.

3059.title: Commend and congratulate John Craven; upon being named 2011 Assistant Principal of the Year.
3059.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating John Craven For Being Selected By The Mississippi Association Of Secondary School Principals As 2011 Assistant Principal Of The Year.

3060.title: Recognize the DuBard School for Language Disorders on its 50th Anniversary.
